description:
I would give this place 10 stars if I could! Golden coffee shop is a cute little diner style restaurant with counter top seats on Sutter Ave.

I mean I'm not sure if anyone cares about this...but the interior design is ADORABLE. The pink walls make me feel like I'm in a rom-com movie, waiting to for my Prince Charming to walk through the doors and order the same thing as me..?? LOL. 

Anyways, the food here is absolutely DELICIOUS AND CHEAP!! The prices are so affordable, no where can you find these kinds of prices in San Francisco. I ordered the Jack, Avocado, and Salsa omelette for $7.95! It comes with slices of bread (your choice, I chose sourdough) and hash browns! It's a family owned business and you can tell they work so hard. My friend ordered the waffles with fresh strawberries and whipped cream and it looked mouthwatering. She said she thoroughly enjoyed that as well. Service is good too, nothing too special but all the workers have a smile on their face which made me feel very welcomed :-)

Oh! And despite yelp's information, they DO take credit cards which is a +++

I wish I had a Golden Coffee Shop in the Silicon Valley I would be there every weekend. Ughh!! 10000 stars.
author: Serina L.

description: This is the greatest and cutest and cheapest diner in all of SF. The walls are pink. They serve Chinese food (which is actually really good). The staff is friendly. The service isn't too slow. But really it's a cute little diner servicing decent food for a decent price. I really like the corned beef hash. I don't know what else to say about this place except that it's my favorite little breastfast place in the city when I just want an easy breakfast. Weekend mornings are definitely busier, but I've never had to wait for a spot at the bar.
author: Alec T.

description:
Basic Breakfast 

This is a cute, corner, straightforward, mom and pop breakfast joint. The service was good and diner was clean. Standard American breakfast. 

We had the French Toast Combo. It came with three hearty pieces of well battered french toast dusted with powdered sugar served with four pieces of thick sliced bacon. 
We also had the egg special that was served with two over easy eggs, excellently prepared and four pieces of tasty sausage. 

Coffee was a nice smooth Seattle's Best. While we are we were entertained watching the cute owners interact with eachother and their customers. Great quick stop for a basic start to the day.
author: Beverly V.

description: A small hole in the wall that exudes hard work and dedication by the  family that runs it.  Greasy spoon but hits the spot when your looking for a traditional breakfast...just know it takes time as they cook to order.  Being small and quaint you get friendly service however it only accommodates 20 people at the most with the majority at the breakfast bar.
author: Cammi G.

description: Long live Golden Coffee! I love this place and was so sad when they were closed, but the new owners have really turned it around! You can't go wrong with a cheap Saturday morning breakfast that doesn't break the bank. Ps - they take card now
author: Megan M.

description:
Was happy to find this place open on July 4 after the Moulin Rogue restaurant was sadly closed. 

This place is like the traditional greasy spoon diner of old. Even the plastic cups seemed ancient. We were able to get seated fairly quickly at the counter. 

I ordered corned beef hash and scrambled eggs. Lots of yelp reviewers had raved about them.  Hash browns and white toast came with it. I wish wheat was an option. Sadly, the hash seemed straight out of the can. Not sure what previous reviewers were going ga ga over. The hash browns were on point. Very crispy. And, the scrambled eggs were perfectly cooked. Very moist. 

It took awhile for our water to be refilled. The eggs that I received were not scrambled like i asked for. That was remedied. The servers werent friendly, but more business-like. Reinforcements were brought in later to help with the large number of customers. 

Sadly, what it comes down to is that I can get canned corned beef hash at home. I don't need to come here for that. My girlfriend also makes really great corned beef hash. I won't be back. There are other places out there to try.
author: Sean A.

description: Great food, friendly service, ideal location. If you want a traditional diner breakfast look no further.
author: Andrew W.

description:
5 stars for the price
2.5 for food
Service isnt great but there's like 3 grandparents working there... And the price is so cheap, no biggie!

Ordered the waffles with eggs and bacon and another with sausage. My other friend ordered eggs with hashbrowns and bacon. 

She raved about the hashbrowns.

While the price is great, food was mediocre at best, burnt to a certain degree, and while the waffle was good, it took another 15 minutes for the rest of my meal to arrive... Then another 10 for my friend's waffle to arrive... Then another 5 and 10 and etc for my other friend's meal to arrive...

So while the prices are great I think I'll pay another dollar or two and go to Eddy's so the meals can come out somewhat closer together lol. 

Or I'll venture back solo. 

PS. Cash only
author: Mandi W.

description: This little diner delivers!!!  Has all the traditional #breakfast diner stuff, but then extends menu with a great Chinese spread for lunch & dinner.  An old school gem in San Francisco!
author: Keala V.

description: We have been coming to Golden Coffee for years and while you cannot beat the price and portions, since being under new management the wait times and service have gone downhill big time. Still hoping they can work out the kinks because $8 breakfast that leaves you stuffed is a rarity here :)
author: Siobhain G.

description: Finally had the chance to go here and on all the days Labor Day.  My partner and I sat at the counter and was greeted warmly by a young woman. We ordered the French toast, buttermilk pancakes, and hash browns. Delicious! Hands down! The chef was also very kind as well.  And finally, the prices! You can't beat a breakfast for $25! This lil shop is definitely going to be a weekend spot for sure!
author: Kojuan W.

description: Nice little place, reasonable prices. Be aware they have more counter seating then tables. Went for breakfast and ordered over easy eggs, crisp bacon and hash browns. Everything was cooked to perfection, which is awesome because I hate rubbery bacon. The service was friendly, but not fast.. be prepared to take your time. That's the reason it only got 4 stars, it was sloooow. So if you have the time to wait, I would recommend that you give them a try
author: Laura P.

description: If your girlfriend thinks you are cheap because you go here please DUMP her ass. Simple and perfect food all of the time. Dottie's is down on 6th street with a two hour wait if that makes her feel better. Drunken crack heads are free while you wait for a table. Eggs over easy, sausage, bacon and hash browns extra crispy. ALWAYS done right.
author: Dookie B.

description: This place is great.  Quick quality breakfast at a reasonable price.  Family owned and run.  Just super nice people's.
author: Chris C.

description:
If you ever have the urge for something simple yet utterly delicious and satisfying, especially if that craving is eggs, pancakes, crispy pancakes, and watered down but hot coffee, than this is your place!

It's a classic side-of-the-road greasy spoon diner located central in San Francisco. The prices are modest, owners are as nice as pie, and the meal is always so satisfying. 

If you are staying local, give this place a shot.
author: Roman V.

description: Cute atmosphere, great location, friendly service, good coffee and breakfast. French toast left a little to be desired but omelettes and hash browns were great.
author: Mikko S.

description: Top of my list for neighborhood breakfast spots. However, NO FRILLS, I think that's why I like it so much. Old school diner, old school menu, old school prices. Small space so seating can be limited during lunch but I've never had to wait for a seat. Long story short, if you're high maintenance don't go here, but if you just want a quick, simple breakfast or you need to cure a hangover, this is the spot. My whole breakfast in the picture cost $7.54 after tax!
author: Ryan P.

description:
This place really is a gem at the corner of crowded and dirty. 

The good service and delicious food are pretty unexpected at this place. The restaurant literally only seats like 20 people - there is a U shaped bar and 2 tables to the side. I was in a party of 3, and the older woman helped to accommodate us to sit together at the bar.

The food is well made - I got the french toast combo, the french toast was excellent, the bacon pretty good, and my eggs were quite soft. Pancakes were also fluffy and moist. Waffle was also fluffy and just kinda melted in your mouth.

I thought the coffee was fine, yea it's not the best, but fine for a place like this.

Also, the prices are pretty low for being in SF.
author: Spencer H.

description:
TL;DR - This is not one of those bougie brunch spots that serve mimosas and gourmet BS.

If you've got over an hour to kill, this place is the BEST place to grab breakfast. You sit around a bar and an auntie will come and take your order. No waiting list, no place to sit and wait. Very minimal, but that is kind of the appeal of it. 

Food here is typical diner fare at diner prices. I gotta say, the french toast and club sando are OUT OF THIS WORLD. 

Not really food for the super health conscious, but I've never cared too much for kale at breakfast anyway.

Service is slow, but its a small family run business. They go in the order of people who order and there's no kitchen staff other than the grandpa so plates come out one at a time. Don't complain!
author: Crystal Z.

description: OMG, what a sweet Mom & Pop shop. Not the cleanest nor most up-to-date place, but if you want a great breakfast and very inexpensive for San Francisco, this is the place.
author: Terese C.

description:
If you're seeking a cheap and hearty breakfast or brunch this is your spot! Prices are much appreciated when dining in The City. Located right on the corner of Sutter and Leavenworth so it's an easy find. It's cash only so come prepared or stop by the ATM at the convenience store across the street. 

It's a very mom and pop place. Locals come here to dine and catch up on the daily paper. Fixtures and seating are dated but I think it adds to its charm. Plus places like this tend to have really good and cheap food! I had the veggie omelette and included all the veggies you associate with it plus spinach. It also comes with hash browns that I happily placed a side order of corned beef hash on top of (muahaha). Add a cup of coffee and all was less than $12. I was full and happy and ready to venture around SF and didn't bother to eat until dinner time.
author: Joshua R.

description: Great breakfast!! I love a good simple diner-esque breakfast and this was perfect. The space is quaint, bright and clean and the staff is kind. Not to mention the food was delicious! I personally like my meats well-done and crispy so the bacon and sausage were perfect for my taste, but if you don't like crispy then I'd ask for them not to cook it so long. Food was delicious, exactly what I want in breakfast/brunch.
author: Troi H.

description:
Very cute place. The staff is very nice and attentive. 
The menu is simple but the food was good.
author: Steph R.

description:
Affordable, delicious food in an area of sletch. This little shop was perfect for our morning brunch.  The seating is limited (a horseshoe bar with the staff in the middle and the grill along the back wall), but the food was great and priced very reasonably.  It's pretty divey but you are paying for cheap delicious food, not amazing decor.. which I prefer, rather than the opposite. 

*Cash only
author: Katy E.

description: Yeesh. If you're into dive breakfast joints maybe this ones for you! I got an egg with avocado and toast (basic.) I always test a breakfast place by asking for my egg over medium and when I get it over easy or raw (which is 99% of the time) then I'm unimpressed! It's not hard! If you're cracking eggs all day you should know the difference. The dishes were dirty and the place was outdated. I wanted to wash my dishes before using them. I can't believe in the heart of San Fran that places like this last!
author: Monica T.

description: The place is very charming, has the "place that the locals go to" vibe. Nothing fancy or hip, but with a very pleasant atmosphere anyway. The prices are very reasonable and the staff is very kind. The food was fresh and tasty. A five-star breakfast/brunch choice for me!
author: Borys K.

description: So cheap and so delicious!! Such kind and friendly workers! Highly suggest going here if you're on a budget looking for a decent breakfast in the city. They have a very cute pink diner sort of aesthetic. My entire family was very happy with this spot.
author: Carrie S.

description: This was an okay restaurant. Food was ehh, I'm 100% sure they're way better little coffee shops than this one. The waitress got my order completely wrong. I was not in the mood nor did i have time to wait for the cook to redo my order. I ordered a veggie omelette with NO mushrooms and I got a veggie omelette with mushrooms. For some random reason i decided to get fried rice and all I got in my dish was white rice, scrambled eggs and green onions?? For sure I won't be coming back nor do I recommend to waste your money here.
author: Lilly V.

description: This place is an exercise in minimalist dining. It's a small square space with a horseshoe shaper counter. Everything that goes on in this place is seen by everyone in the place. It's very bright with lots of windows, right on the corner. The prices are reasonable and the menu is typical coffee shop fare. I've eaten there three times and it's consistently above average. The service is very good...like I said, everybody can see everybody so your server can't disappear for ten minutes while you wait for a refill. The omelets are the real deal here...big fluffy omelets with a lot of whatever you want. The steak and eggs was also very generous...in three visits I have not come close to eating all my food. It's a great place to read the paper and have a cup of coffee. The decor, well, there just isn't any...but the food is great.
author: Rodney M.

description: Nobody is in a hurry here. Wait staff not particularly attuned to your caffeine addiction or hunger. Bring something to read. Great greasy traditional American breakfast and stir fried food once you get it. And the place is kind of old school diner adorable. The newly painted pink walls are begging for a local artist to hang some work. Just remember, patience is a virtue.
author: Ally S.

description:
My dad used to take my sister and me here when we were young...probably 25-30 years ago. As the years passed, we both moved out of the city as young adults and our father passed away. I would fondly remember this place but I couldn't remember exactly where it was located, I knew it was somewhere near the Tenderloin-ish area, on a corner, and on a hill. I figured it was probably out of business and stopped obsessing over trying to find it. This past weekend...I found it! I cannot believe this place is still around and when you walk in, it feels like nothing has changed! This place is straight up stuck in the 70's-80's. It's so awesome.

The food is hella cheap and good. I ordered the corned beef hash, hash browns, and eggs over easy...all for under $7?! What?!
My wife ordered an egg and bacon with toast...under $5?!
This is Twilight Zone prices...on the real.   

Our total was like $14. So unreal and the food is still hella good.
author: Vanessa O.

description: 35 minutes for a BLT. And the fries were burnt. Dirty table, too.  Gotta type more to meet review minimum. Let's see...  rest of food was okay, but the the four of us all received our meals at different times, about 5 minutes apart.
author: Victor N.

description: Simple. Tasty. Super cheap. The set up is nice--bar surrounding the kitchen area. Will be back!
author: Aubrey W.

description:
We found this place when staying at the Marquis by Marriott downtown SF. It was a nice walk and also seemed to have a piece of both environment and home feel to it when finding on yelp. 
So, we walked.
Upon arriving we found the place to have limited seating but was filled, normally a good sign. Also a good sign in SF. 
The food was cooked to order, you could even watch the chef cook! He must've been cooking at that stove for the past 20 years, or so it seemed. 
I got the corned beef hash (canned hash) and she got a strawberry waffle. (Fresh strawberries) 
Now normally I would mention how I don't like the canned kind but this was surprisingly fitting. For the price and service I felt more than satisfied and also full. She liked the waffle and we both thought the coffee was good. 
Cheap eats are hard to find in SF. This is a great spot. Will be returning, most definitely.
author: Jacob B.

description:
We were visiting from the best city in the world, New York City. As young adults just out of school we were looking for the best bang for our buck and boy did we find it here.

It's definitely a "hole in the wall" kind of place, but for 15 dollars, can't beat it. 

If you're looking for a dining experience, this isn't the place, but if you want quick in and out food of all varieties, you found it.
author: Alex O.

description: The food was ehhh, I got the French toast and it wasn't anything spectacular. The service was good, and my food was ready fairly quick. Not the cleanest of places, but does anyone go to a place like this because of that?
author: Sierra S.

description:
As good as it gets!! This place is amazing.

Seriously, where can you find typical american breakfast for less than 10$ now a days?
Breakfast and bunch is seriously over priced and overrated around the city now with bacon and eggs for $15..
So happy to find a breakfast joint that caters to my american breakfast cravings for cheap!!

Two eggs + has browns here costs ~$4.00! what?? yepppp. 
I really like the corned beef has + eggs here, which is only $6.50 :) 
NY steak + eggs.. $9.95. Definitely a score!

It's always a full house on the weekends and 
The bottle neck here is definitely the food, which takes while to come out because there's only one chef cooking for the whole place.

Very solid american breakfast, no complaints.
author: Leilani Y.

description: There's a reason you walk by here and it's a full house.  Old school diner with old school prices, which make for a more than great morning breakfast.  Watching the older gentleman flick his wrist is therapeutic since their mission is simple: serve good breakfast with good prices. Truly a gem.
author: Cynthia A.

description: Black darker than a black hole pancakes.  Scrambled eggs were good, bacon was ok.  Never ever coming here again because they tried to hide the burned pancakes by keeping dark side down.  As if I wouldn't notice.  Ugh. It's all about the attitude.
author: Vic K.

description: Typical American breakfast.  If you're not looking for a fancy place, just good food for a fair price.  Come here.  Omelette is best to get.  I got a Denver and the peppers & onions are freshly chopped.  Awesome, fresh and fluffy.  Mostly everything on the menu are under $7 - just good breakfast!
author: Amy H.

description: Old style breakfast joint , regular food , regular menu. Food was good , nothing Special and descent priced for sf . Might come back if I'm the area , place is kinda small but there was plenty of seats available around 1130 am
author: G M.

description: Food was great, service is a little slow amd un- organised with a communication barrier.... Asians run then place...
author: Rick R.

description: I had some yummy banana pancakes. The waitress was friendly and it was not at all crowded around lunchtime.
author: Izzy S.

description:
Hole-in-the-wall mom and pops café.  Nothing fancy, just good breakfast and coffee.

Ordered the Denver Omelet.  Made with 3 eggs.  Good!  Often find the breakfast places uses only 2 eggs so no extra charge this time :-)

Eggs, green peppers, onion, tomato and Swiss cheese.  Hash browns and white toast.  Saw wheat toast but forgot to ask for it.

Tasty and filling breakfast.  Very reasonably priced in San Fransisco!
author: A J.

description:
This is an adorable family-run shop. It's not the cleanest place nor more delicious food you'll ever have, but you can walk out of there feeling full and caffeinated for less than $8  - nearly impossible elsewhere in SF. 

For the past few months, they've had a sign up saying they're closed, but recently I've seen some movement inside. Fingers crossed for a re-opening soon!
author: Jen K.

description:
Fantastic little hole-in-the-wall breakfast spot in the heart of downtown. Seemingly ran by an Asian family, they crank out hearty breakfast plates in impressive portions and at respectable prices.

I adored the two (2) buttermilk pancakes. I also loved my Joe's Omelette, an omelette featuring ground beef, cheese, and a variety of veggies. I thought it lacked seasoning, though. I hardly ever add salt to anything, but I did find myself picking up the salt shaker and tabasco here. 

Looks like this is a locals beehive, and I can understand why. If I lived in the area I'd probably find myself at Golden Coffee Shop regularly. 

A bit of constructive criticism -- they should clean the dirt out of the window seals and wipe down the walls.
author: Gary R.

description: Love this greasy spoon known as Golden Coffee Shop! Always love the potatoes and eggs! Breakfast on a budget for sure. This is delicious and reliable! I encourage everyone to give it a shot.
author: Peter C.

description: Really basic breakfasts that are extremely delicious! Also one of the best cups of coffee I've ever had. The family that owns it is really nice and were great servers/cook. Food tasted fresh and awesome. Definently a place you should stop if you're in San Francisco!
author: Austin S.

description:
For a "coffee" shop, the coffee is pretty terrible. The food was decent for the price. Hash was not homemade, it was canned. They serve up an extra side of grease with every meal.  Friend said his French toast was good.
Good place for those on a budget. If you are the type who has to eat in a "clean" place... This is not for you.
Terrible coffee.

Cash only.
Bathroom was a scary experience.
author: Derek R.

description: So good! Visiting and staying on Nob Hill. Great inexpensive place for the diner basics. Quality and consistency. We had an omelette with sausage, jack cheese, avocado and salsa with crispy hash browns and toast. Also, pancakes with strawberries and whipped cream. So good we came back a second day and ordered the exact same. Not fancy but terrific.
author: Dennis F.

description:
Been here countless times for Sunday breakfast before hitting the farmer's market. Food is consistently great and cheap. It's nothing fancy, but I like my breakfast simple most days. 

This is not one of those ubiquitous "brunch" spots; it's a small, homely place and I wouldn't recommend coming with more than 4 people. There are two 4-seat tables on either side of the entrance and the rest is bar seating (15 or so). They keep things humming along pretty quickly, I've never had to wait to be seated during prime breakfasting hours. 

I usually stick to the corned beef hash and eggs with extra crispy hash browns (savory), but sometimes I shoot for the waffle and sausage (sweet). The waffles are not belgian by any means, they're more like a large eggo/pancake hybrid. When I'm feeling extra pretentious, I bring my own maple syrup and it really makes a big difference. I've also heard good things about the french toast, buttermilk pancakes, and pork chop plate.

Give this place a try if you're in the neighborhood! Just skip the coffee, it's not the greatest.
author: Shaina V.

description:
There isn't much seating at this place (mostly counter seating) and if you go during prime hours it is usually full.

Every item on the menu is pretty inexpensive. However the entrees they offer are pretty basic...anyone could make any of the entrees if they weren't lazy and decided to come here instead. For breakfast they offer typical pancakes, French toast, omelets, eggs, hash, toast, etc. To be honest I would rather go home and just make these items myself so I could put less butter, oil, sugar in them. I definitely felt greasy and gross after leaving. I ordered the jack avocado omelet. The hash was pretty oily and so was the omelet. I could tell the omelet was prob cooked in a huge pan of vegetable oil. One other reviewer mentioned the salsa tasted like it came out of a jar. This is so true! Don't expect any homemade salsas but then again the prices here should be enough to tell you.

This place is great if you are on a budget. You definitely get a lot of food for what you pay for which is a plus. In addition to your omelet, you get hash and buttered toast.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Great easy simple family run place. Limited seating, but enjoyable being able to watch the food be cooked from the horseshoe shaped bar.

Waffle and eggs delicious as well  as omelettes
author: Jack A.

description: It is our first time in San Francisco. This is a great place to have breakfast for a very low cost!!! The service is excellent!!! You may need to wait a bit because all food is made at the moment, but it's worth it. It's feels like home.
author: Claribel M.

description: the best no-frills diner you'll find in san francisco. affordable, (cash-only) reliable, filling breakfast foods to satisfy your cravings for pancakes or an omelette-- sit around the U-shaped counter and enjoy the ambiance of a simplified, casual, friendly diner. My favorite menu item is the veggie omelette
author: Haley D.

description: Disgusting place with filthy looking tables and dirty looking cook and server. We walked out. Another example that the drug addicts of American will eat anything
author: John C.

description: First time in San Francisco so I yelped breakfast and this popped up. Nice walk from my hotel and when I got there it wasn't that busy. Ordered the 2 eggs & 4 bacon with toast and it was everything I wanted and more, especially for 7 dollars. Food was ready in 5 minutes, definitely would come back again!
author: Suzanne C.

description: Cute "hole in the wall" place filled with the smell of breakfast and owned by a hard working family. I typically go for the  corn beef hash and a sunny side up egg with sour dough bread (+strawberry jam) which is a steal for ~$8! The food can take some time to come out if there is a rush of people that come in all at once but typically comes out within 10 minutes (only one chef). Love sitting at the counter watching all the action. Nothing is fancy about the menu and everything is very basic but I love coming here.
author: Lauren K.

description: I came here looking for a cheap brunch spot and this place had promising reviews. I do not know why this place is highly rated because the food is terrible. I had French toast which looked like regular white bread with scrambled eggs stuck on it. I got it with a side of bacon, which came out overcooked. My friend got a BLT. It's just a sandwich and I didn't think it could be bad, but it was. The bacon was raw, basically, and the bread was just barely toasted. The fries it came with were as crispy as potato chips. I didn't come here looking for a gourmet meal but even though the food was cheap I felt like I had wasted my money.
author: Rebecca L.

description: Great little cafe run by an older couple, they are there everyday! Cheap prices, you can eat a huge breakfast for under $10!  Its my go to every time I have to go back to San Francisco!
author: Richard H.

description:
TLDR; fantastic diner with prices like it was still the 80s
---
You've just spent the entire weekend watching the hit Netflix original, Stranger Things. It's a show about a group of adolescent friends banding together with a psychokinetic girl who eats Eggo waffles to uncover the truth about a sinister government cover-up and finding their friend who has been taken by an insidious being. The blend of science fiction, horror and 80s pop culture have drawn you in completely; you haven't felt this connected to a show since the 2003 cultural zeitgeist The O.C., widely regarded by historians and theoretical physicists as the most important human achievement of the 21st century.

"Not again," your roommate Matt complains, as you restart the season for the third time in a row. You walk over to the chair you have him duct taped to and reapply his gag. While you are trying to shove a 24 Hour fitness gym towel in his mouth he manages to sputter out, "Just stop eating the weed brownies! This always happens! Bad things always happen!"

This triggers a split-flashback of you taking over the Large Hadron Collider in Geneva, Switzerland in an attempt to make Orange Chicken and inadvertently ending the universe: http://bit.ly/29O7FOd

What was that? It felt so real. You shake it off but contemplate your roommate Matt's warning about the weed brownies. You take another bite. 

Left with too many questions at the end of the season finale, you decide that you must travel back to the 80s and figure out how the story ends. 

Go to Golden Coffee Shop where the 80s never ended. From the prices to the décor, this place has been caught in a time bubble and protected from the horrors of modernization. 

To find out what happened to Eleven you have to become Eleven. Order her favorite food. 

"Gimme a Lego," you shout to no one in particular as you burst through the door. Sit at the counter and compose yourself. Do not take another bite of the weed brownie. 

You take another bite of the weed brownie. 

"Gimme a Lego," you say again to the waitress. 

She looks at you in confusion.

"Leggo my Eggo," you blurt out. 

She takes a step back. 

"Legolas!" you yell while pointing to the terrified patron's waffle who is sitting next to you. 

The waitress picks up the phone. 

"Secret Things is the best show about Eggo friends!" you yell to the startled crowd. 

This is taking too long to find resolution. You grab a knife and cut yourself to draw blood and summon the monster to get to the Outside World.  

As your first drop of blood hits the floor Mitt Romney appears in a cloud of smoke. Your vision becomes blurry since your ulnar artery won't stop leaking and you pass out. 

Death, in the form of a crow's skull appears before you. "Not you again," he says.
author: Dave G.

description:
I am a cat who rarely eats out for breakfast. lunch, dinner, late night bite? sure, but breakfast is sort of a rarity to me when it comes to eating somewhere other than the home. 
that said, as a roaming cat of SF, I happened to see a friend recommend this place as a good simple breakfast spot, so I decided to give it a go, and make my way to this place. 

needless to say, upon walking in, I was a bit surprised to find a very small place with a large bar style table around a kitchen of sorts. looking around, I wouldn't give this place any extra points on decor or cleanliness, but it wasn't too bad. I am one who judges more on service and food quality anyways. 

a woman took my order and she was quite nice. despite it being pretty hectic here, she always kept my water filled. 

I decided to order the Joes special with hash browns and English muffin. the English muffin was served first and the hash browns and eggs were served a few minutes later. I have to say, I like the way they prepared the egg here. it was much more flavorful than some other breakfast spots I have been to where despite being rated well, their eggs seemed bland. here there was a lot of good flavor which I truly appreciated. the hash browns were nothing too special, but were a good  accompaniment. 

note that this place is cash only which makes it a place I can see a lot of regulars going to, but probably not tourist necessarily. 

overall, while not pretty to look at, I can say that this place is somewhere I would definitely go to again when I'm looking for a quick breakfast that is very well priced and easy. nice little place that I can see being a regular spot for many! 

*chirp!*
author: Jei C.

description: Lovely owners. Great food for the price. Don't understand why anyone would give lower rating. I 've been tgere,many times and love the food for its price.
author: calvin s.

description: Found this place thanks to yelp. Very simple Old-school diner with good food at great prices. Had the corned beef hash with 2 eggs, hash browns and toast for $7.55 including tax. Crazy cheap for SF. Lots of locals eat here, which is a good sign. I like the fact that there wasn't a long wait like at the Taylor Street coffee shop that I have been to many times. And the food was much cheaper and just as good.
author: D P.

description: Food is delicious. But the place is super outdated and seems "not clean" - but it could just be that it's outdated and old restaurant furniture. Coffee not good- go across the street to cup of Joe. But the food was surprisingly good. Not much room in the restaurant for groups bigger than 4. And mostly counter seats  worth a try if you are in this area.
author: Ani K.

description: YEAH!!! They are finally back.  I've missed my favorite neighborhood breakfast place where the French toast is Devine and the service is magnificent.  Welcome back!!!
author: Hazel L.

description:
This little dive's 4-stars are well-earned. No, it is not the same 4-stars as, say, Zuni or Delfina. But for what it is -- a neighborhood divey greasy spoon -- it's practically perfect.

I have done some snooping on the interwebs, but can find no history on the place. I suppose I could ask the folks that work there, but they're all so damn busy (and efficient). All I know is that I have been going there for almost 20 years now, and it's great. In my mind it has been open for decades, run by multiple generations of the same Chinese family. But that's just my dive fantasy... 

Love the wrap-around counter, and because I generally go there by myself I rarely wait for a seat -- parties of 3+ will be more challenged. People watching is an added benefit to the counter: the odd old neighborhood farts you know who have been dining there for decades, European tourists, and (now) douchey hipsters who sadly discovered this gem a few years ago. Oh well...

Again, all good diner food. My go-to's are the Denver omelet or the steak and eggs (the hash browns are aways perfect), and a burger or BLT (and the fries are aways perfect). The coffee? Meh. It's okay. I have certainly had worse. They do some Chinese rice dishes, none of which I have tried. It's rare for me to leave with a check more than $10.

So, get it on your list.
author: Corey M.

description:
Exactly the kind of small hometown local diner I had in mind.  I'm originally from NJ and it's often hard to find a NJ style diner of this caliber.   Golden Coffee Shop is an honest diner experience -while on the road, it is a friendly piece of home.

I had the "Joes Special" from the omelette menu.  It has the typical amount of food & grease I expected from a good diner - it was on point.  The coffee was smooth & just what I needed to get me going for the day.  

Excellent food, coffee and old school east coast diner style feel.  I will visit Golden Coffee Shop again!
author: Mike P.

description: This is a classic corner coffee shop, greasy-spoon type. Often busy, good food, not great, and very inexpensive. Highly recommend for the quick lunch or breakfast, corner location, and dynamic people watching.
author: Greg W.

description: We love the place, it is good for breakfast especially if you are in a hurry.
author: Mega Team R.

description: No frills coffee shop. Don't expect anything fancy here. Just good old fashioned diner breakfast food at reasonable prices. A rarity in sf these days.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Golden Coffee shop is the epitome of a perfect greasy spoon, no frills, locals love it, diner. When we have guests in town and want to eat breakfast without it being a big production, or hell, whenever WE want to eat without it being a sh!t show, we head to Golden Coffee. Everything is great. I have never had anything I didn't like. Big portions of legit breakfast food for prices that will make you feel like it's 2009 and the rich kids haven't moved in and upped the price of everything yet. If you sit at the counter, watch the magical man that cooks everything. I bet he flips perfect over easy eggs in his sleep. As mentioned, the place is no frills, so don't take your fancy ass here expecting mimosas and locally sourced free range eggs. Take your hungry, hungover ass here for text book breakfast food that will cure the hunger pangs away.
author: Liz M.

description:
Inside nothing fancy but the breakfast food is amazing. Just your basic breakfast food made really well. 

Don't let the Asian family throw you off...they can really cook it up. Very affordable as well. It was perfect!
author: Lukas S.

description: Nostalgic, old school breakfast and coffee joint at it's finest. Don't let the bare walls and basic decor fool you. This place is top notch and inexpensive with all the essential elements of a culminating breakfast. The slightly crisped edges of my sunny side up eggs and the zen master in the kitchen had me come two days in a row. A truly golden experience.
author: Greg F.

description:
A neighborhood mom & pop breakfast diner. 

Super affordable menu with items starting under $5. 

You can get 1 egg or 2 or 3 done any way you like served with hash-browns & a side of buttered toasts and jelly.

Their omelets are very filling. I rarely ever finish one. My favorites are the joe's omelette and the veggie omelette. 

The chicken soup is pretty yummy, too. Especially when you dip the toasted dinner roll into it. Perfect for a cold day or when you're feeling a bit unwell. 

Corned-beef hash is a bit salty but pretty alright, too. 

The service is quite fast.
Come in with low expectations and some cash.
author: Châu B.

description: This is like your typical old-school breakfast diner.  Me and my friend were looking for a place to grab breakfast near our hotel (Hotel Vertigo) and this place was conveniently like a block away! This place serves your typical breakfast foods and it is awesome because you can watch them cook it with the center bar in the middle of the restaurant and a few tables on the corners.  The prices are pretty cheap for SF too! I ordered the corned beef hash and eggs and it was A LOT of food for the price.  The service was pretty good as well.  I would definitely come back here next time I'm in the area!
author: Cynthia L.

description: No frills breakfast. Perfect - it was $15 for 2 people.  I got 2 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage, hash browns and toast. Everything you want for breakfast!  Very small place -2 tables inside and counter top around the restaurant. You can watch the cook the entire time which I really like too.  Place isn't super clean and new, but food is worth it. Cash only!
author: Joanna D.

description: I always go here for breakfast because I like  watching the old man work the grill. The prices are great and food is vey much San Francisco's Asian owned version of the Waffle House.  Yum. I love that has been here forever and it is cash only
author: Sfclint O.

description: We were excited for the waffles but they tasted like pancakes. They have really good crispy bacon. I wasn't too pleased with the coffee, it had no taste to it. The staff was friendly.
author: Fabi V.

description: The breakfast was good and very classic "Diner" style. This establishment takes cash only so leave your plastic at home!  The service could have been way better. Service was slow, coffee refills took forever and just even getting the attention of staff wasn't easy!
author: Gregory Z.

description:
So many memories here! Great place for breakfast after a night out of drinking.

FOOD- Simple, comforting, filling, has hangover healing properties. Mostly breakfast stuff with a few other lunch options (including Chinese food) in the back of the menu. I get the same thing every time I go here: waffle deluxe with one egg and 2 bacons and a side of toast with coffee of course. The waffles are amazing. Very cheap, I think my whole meal including coffee is $8.

SERVICE- Quick. The staff doesn't speak much English, but they are polite. I believe they are all family it seems.

AMBIANCE- Ever heard of a greasy spoon? This is it. Most of the seating is along a center bar, with 2 table near the windows. The only decorations are 2 calendars, a lucky cat, and a gourd like thing hanging off the wall if I remember correctly. 

Overall this place is great, cheap, fast, and has a kitschy charm. Must go if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Marie O.

description: DELICIOUS breakfast and cheap as hell!  Tiny spot with limited seats, expect the counter staff to try and rush you out as soon as you're done.  The waffles are totally worth it though.
author: Marsha B.

description: Amazing food.  Super efficient.  Way spartan in decor and ambiance, exactly what I want in a breakfast spot.  No fluffy brunchy mcbruncherson for me on a fuzzy weekend morning.  Just give me copious amounts of coffee and delicious grub.  Please, no conversation or bottomless mimosa swilling "Sunday Funday" folks.  I had my fun the night before and lived to tell about it, rookies.
author: Elizabeth V.

description: No fuss diner run by hard working people offering fast service. Don't come here if you're looking for an organic egg white omelet with spinach and imported cheese from France - not the place! Classic, always good diner food where your coffee cup will never be empty. I always get the corned beef hash with scrambled eggs and hashbrowns - $9.45. Cash only! (ATM across the street at Yoyo's market/bodega)
author: Haley M.

description:
Solid. Come here for the prices, not the quality of food. 

I stumbled upon this little store on my way to Brenda's for some ridiculously heavy brunchin', somewhat naively hoping that the wait would be somehow under an hour. Obviously not. 

Stumbled back to this little place for some placeholder breakfast until the next large scale San Francisco wide event (Santa con) to pull San Franciscans away from their beloved Brenda's so I can get into the damned building. 

Anyways, breakfast here is ridiculously cheap. Pancakes taste like they are made from a bisquick mix, but that's to be expected. This isn't mymy's. 

Stark white walls, grill in the back, some service counter smack dab in the middle. Service is friendly, attentive when you need it. Definitely come here is you live in the area and are feeling lazy on a Saturday or Sunday morning. Not Sunday brunch pilgrimage worth it, but solid food nonetheless!
author: Patricia K.

description: Family run business great prices I'm from Sacramento and I saw this place on yelp and I don't regret coming here I ate the food here and I'll tell you it's just as Moma made it. Even though seating is a problem. The food made up for it the food was outstanding I would recommend this place to anybody who wants to go eat breakfast. Fast easy good food and low prices !!!
author: Albert F.

description:
Our favorite in the neighborhood! Ok, it's cutre lux and there may be a line.... But it's as worth as waiting gets. 
Food is really good, feel good, taste good, cooked in front of you. Friendly for conversations with strangers, and good super fast service.
Hash browns. Bacon. Eggs. Yeah!
author: Krito R.

description: The good: cheap, fast service. The bad: slightly undercooked scrambled eggs, bland French toast. There are plenty of other breakfast places nearby, and I'd try somewhere else if I wanted a breakfast near here again.
author: Alec W.

description:
I felt crazy giving a diner 5 stars, but this place nails it!  Specifically the cheeseburger and fries hit the spot.  The burger was juicy and flavorful, and the fries were perfectly crispy.  They really put the fries in friends. I was blown away by the burger and fries!!

I have had breakfast items here before and can say they really nailed the diner food.
author: Jesse K.

description: You wanna eat like the locals in San Fran, this is the place to go. San Francisco is the most expensive city in the US so when it comes to saving every penny counts. Golden Cafe offers awesome breakfasts, for amazing prices. Place is very small so not a restaurant for big parties.
author: Luis P.

description: The food was great!!!! The French toast was really delicious even though it had no special flavor to it. The eggs and hash browns were perfect and went very well together. The only negative is that it was super cold inside...
author: Ida A.

description:
This diner is the classic greasy spoon. Breakfast is dope as is the grilled cheese sandwich. Service is fast but not personable despite some of the regulars attempts to force the issue. 
It's a U shaped counter and there two tables for small groups. 
The 3 stars are the strongest 3 stars, the best 3 stars.
author: Tommy W.

description: I was there in July 2016.I was very happy to discover the place.Primarily cheap.Second, and most important speed and taste.Employees doing many things at the same time.The Cook's cafe Owner at the same time.His Wife, both the waitress and cashier.A perfect couple.I plan to eat there again when I go to San Francisco again.
author: Fm Y.

description:
This place is just so many levels of happy. It's delicious, simple, clean enough, quick, consistent and cheap. Grab a stool at their quaint little U-Shaped bar and you'll be helped right away. Like previous Yelpers, you almost don't want to share it because it's so wonderfully unchanged and popularity makes it less of a simple pleasure. 

Food - My go-to meal is coffee, veggie omelet (no cheese needed it is so yummy on its own) and sourdough. The omelet is loaded with fresh veggies and the homemade hashbrowns are the perfect blend of soft and crispy - not too greasy either. My BF is picky about his corned beef hash and loves theirs. Most things come as A La Carte so you can pick and choose easily.

Price- We both get coffee and add-ons and our meal totals to a thrilling $20.
author: Amy C.

description: Great place. Food is good and the price is very reasonable. Highly recommend if your looking for an American breakfast. It's a hole in the wall place. Not very nice looking place but that didn't bother me.
author: Joseph F.

description: Like home cooking and eating at home. I loved watching the time tested efficiency of the couple who run the place. My omelette was just what I needed.
author: Keith C.

description: A classic mom & pop shop that offers simple and delicious breakfasts. The menu is very customizable, and allows you to order EXACTLY what you want, and how much. For example, some orders differ by only 1 egg or 1 piece of bacon. I got the Buttermilk Pancakes with a side of Corned Beef Hash, while my boyfriend got Joe's Omelette with a side of hash browns. The portions were huge, and everything came to a total of less than $15! My favourites were the pancakes and the corned beef hash - the pancakes were light and fluffy, and the hash was perfectly crispy.
author: Carolina S.

description:
Pros:
- Pricing of menu items is reasonable.
- Prompt service.
- Table had been wiped down prior to our arrival.
- Hasbrowns are nicely crispy and buttery.

Cons:
- Cash only
- Bare, dusty rose painted walls and visibly worn barstools indicate a neglected interior.
- The older woman working there offered no greeting or smile when she brought us our menu and later, some water. (The younger woman working there, thanked us, and wished us a good day, as we left.)

Tips:
- Pass on the omlette with jack cheese, avocado and salsa. The salsa tasted like something straight from an old jar available at a grocery store.
- Grab your coffee at "Cup A Joe Coffeehouse," at the opposite corner of the intersection.

Notes:
I would not visit again.
author: Pears A.

description:
Going into Golden Coffee Shop, it won't take long to realize what type of breakfast you are going to get. It is going to be buttery, unhealthy, and solve your hunger problem.

The place looks like a bit of a hole in the wall, but that doesn't keep it from being busy with repeat customers. The prices were reasonable and the food lived up to every expectation I had.

I didn't stick around to see the switch to a Chinese lunch menu, but the hole-in-the-wall breakfast cafe food hit the spot!
author: Eric R.

description:
Happy to find & tried this affordable hole-in-the-wall diner! Love the price and food was actually not bad. This place offers good old/simple comfort food. I enjoyed my breakfast.

I believe there were two tables and the rest were counter seating.

Service was just right. Not too much or too little. Came to refill coffee & water. Also, take away your plates when you're done.

Would come back again if I was in the area.
author: Sasa F.

description: Very beautiful place with pleasant atmosphere. Delicious food. Very kind and friendly staff. Fast service and nice cheap prices.
author: Finley F.

description:
When I travel my yelp app rarely leads me astray; this was one of the times it did.

Yes the food is dirt cheap.

My hash browns were barely edible, sitting in a pool of grease. The scrambled eggs tough dry shards of overgrilled crap. The only thing I somewhat liked was the toast and how can you screw that up? Even the bacon was dry and tasteless; I don't think Ive ever had bad bacon until I came here.

The place looks filthy and unless you are in an absolute hurry anyone could prepare better food in their own kitchen.

Take it from an out of towner who made the mistake of coming here; just don't do it
author: Troy H.

description: New favorite little place on Nob Hill. Serving up that perfect Americana breakfast you just wake up craving sometimes. Waitresses are super sweet and the prices are CHEEEEEEEAP! So grateful to have a neighborhood joint like this.
author: Patrique R.

description: Awesome service, more than reasonable prices, and good food.  We've been three times so far, and it's been very consistent.  All the food tastes fresh, and is as describe (no surprises)
author: Durwood F.

description:
Small place I normally wouldn't walk in to eat at based on looks (looks like a hole in the wall) However the food was awesome, the people were friendly and assisted right away.  Price is great also. 

Would definitely recommend people go there and have already told people that they should.
author: Tai J.

description: A big cube off the street.  Don't look for emotional warmth and love from the wait staff.  Not that I'm saying it needs to be there, but, just, don't expect idle chatter.  There's no bathroom and I wonder what hidey hold they have for lots of their stuff.  The food was ok, the service was ok.  They only take $$$, Dollah bills, y'all.  There's about 14 seats around the counter and two tables stuffed tight into the corners that may be able to squeeze in four oompa looompas.
author: Vanessa W.

description:
I used to eat here a few times a week when my office was literally half a block away.

First .... don't expect to walk into a fancy breakfast place! This is a small shop! It has a triangle of seats where sometimes your elbow to elbow with people and 2 tables in the front. Second .... the food, some of it is from a can and they obviously buy their breakfast meats from Costco but they aren't even hiding that fact.

When you need an awesome breakfast .... they have good selection of traditional breakfast items including sausage (Jimmy Dean), bacon (I think Oscar Meyer), and Corned Beef Hash from a large can! The waffles, pancakes, and hash browns are hand made. They also have an amazing chicken soup that is delicious!

If you order a steak you can have it with hash browns or steak rice .... don't want toast? Ask for a dinner roll! They are open to whatever.

Prices are good, very cheap!
author: Kris D.

description:
Star-worthy because price and food go down easily.

Reason Why Instant Oatmeal Won't Do (+'s):

+ PRICE is unbeatable. For $5 I get 2 fluffy buttermilk pancakes, 2 eggs my way and for $1 I get free refills on coffee.

+ FOOD is tasty. No frills. Means eggs probably aren't cage-free but still taste like eggs. Pancakes are fluffy. Hashbrowns aren't oily. Bacon is crisp.

+ PEOPLE WATCHING is awesome. An assortment of characters are seated at the U-shape bar. There is Gramps who guards his creamer, Bed-head who probably wore same clothes as yesterday, and the man who walked out of a Ralph Lauren boutique. Beats playing with your phone.

+ NO WAIT. Usually there is no wait. Stroll up and snag a bar stool or even a chair by the window.


Reason Why Instant Oatmeal Will Do (-'s):

- CASH ONLY. Really? Who uses cash?
- PASS on French Toast. Just processed white bread dipped in egg and milk. Go for pancakes instead.

TIP: Bring cash. Not a place to make a special trip but great if you live in the hood.
author: Yiven C.

description:
nice little mom-pop place.

no frills straightforward breakfast.

had denver omelette.  very good and simple.

the pancakes were good too.

very cheap and fast service.
author: Brian K.

description: This was a cool breakfast diner we ended up at because the lines at several other brunch places were way too long...SF loves to brunch. Really liked the diner vibe here and the food was tasty and cheap! It seemed family run and the seating was interesting at the bar, a unique experience!
author: Chris N.

description:
Great hole in the wall cafe. Had a ham and cheese omelette and hash browns for less than $8. 

Loved it
author: Scott B.

description: This is not your typical fancy spot BUT if you want to eat food with a homemade taste then this is it . They only seat about 20 people at a time and it's all around a bar that faces the cashier. ONE cook who handles all the orders. That was quite impressive to watch. The corned beef hash was my favorite . My BF had the breakfast plate and he loved the sausage. Service was great and prices are CHEAP. 25$!!! Was our whole bill.
author: Maria C.

description: Great spot in SF. Authentic, quaint & efficient. Excellent food! A little slow to take orders, but otherwise, a great experience. The diner has an intimate feel & you can tell the owners/staff works hard to keep this place running.
author: Melissa D.

description: Your basic fast and ok American breakfast next door. Ran by Cantonese and it's reli just food u can make at home easily. I come here when I'm too lazy to cook or go farther to get good brunch. Nothing too special but price is affordable
author: Monnikka M.

description:
Great place to head if you're tired of over priced yuppie SF brunches and/or you're trying to take a new *friend* to brunch the next day and want to spend less than 15$ and be in and out in 30 min. 

It really doesn't look like much from the outside, but there are only about 15 seats in the place and they're almost always full. In SF this is usually a pretty good sign that the food is decent. 

Highlights: Pancakes, hash browns, omelettes (warning: tend to be a little undercooked if you're not into that). 

Skip:
The french toast (just average shitty white bread, ends up being a little dry). It always sounds good but I'm usually underwhelmed.  

Despite the name, definitely skip the coffee here. Do yourself a favor and stop across the street at Cup-A-Joe if you want some, they'll let you bring it in.
author: Hailey H.

description: Love this place. Small, great local place to get a bite to eat like it was made in your own kitchen yet better. Food quick and service is good. No nonsense. No frills. Just hard working owners doing a good job. Hash browns were great. And the corn beef hash was good too. Will be coming back. Wish we had discovered this the first day we were here.
author: Renee M.

description: Great, Quiet place on corner. Easy to find. And pretty good food. Has an motel feel to it but great place to eat.
author: Young S.

description:
I love this place.

Stumbled upon it on a business trip.  There are a lot of pretentious restaurants here, with sky-high prices, and moderate portions...and a line to get in.

As others have mentioned, it is an old diner, probably from the 50s.  U-shaped counter, and a few tables near the windows.  The wife works inside the "U," and hubby works the grill.

Contrary to other reviews, I think their coffee is pretty good, and I'm picky about coffee...I hate weak coffee.

I have always had a special with two eggs, corned beef hash, hashbrowns, and a waffle.  Egg plates come with toast, as well.

Watching pops make the corned beef is amazing.  I don't think it is canned.  He fries it first in a skillet, and then BAKES it...it comes out nice and crisp, yet moist.  Best I've ever had.  The hashbrowns are similar...not overly greasy, yet always crisp and brown.

Waffle: I grew up on "Small-square" waffles, not the ubiquitous "Belgian waffle" with one-inch squares.  The smaller squares/ridges make for a crispier (and tastier) waffle.  No comparison.

A lot of food, and cheap...that breakfast runs about $13 out the door.  

While it looks VERY divey, it seems clean.  It is always Mom and Pop running it (once I saw what I think was the daughter as well).  "Mom" isn't overly friendly, but I think mostly driven by weak English skills.  If you are coming from the Hilton Union Plaza, you have to go through some sketchy areas to get here.  (Lots of bums sleeping on sidewalks). It's worth 
it.

I see a lot of the same locals in here every time...that's a testament in itself.  If you get there much past 8:00am, it starts to fill up, and you might have to wait, although not more than 5-10 minutes.
author: Bruce B.

description: This place is a complete hold in the wall! So brace yourself when you walk in. I thought by the reviews it was a good place little did I know I was walking to a place with cracked title, grease on the walls, dirty silverware. I was so ready to walk out and I really wish I did... I ate a little of my food to not be rude.  They were very quick at preparing your meal but I was absolutely discussed with how dirty the place was:-( as they say most hole in the walls are normally good but due to how dirty it was I was discussed and just could not eat my food! Walking two blocks away from union square is pretty dangerous so just uber and done trust all Yelp reviews no matter how many are listed!!
author: Linda P.

description: Really great breakfast experience!! Food is really high quality and not expensive! Start serving Chinese food after 11:00 am. Breakfast all day!!! Cash only place. Will def come back next time!
author: Linghan S.

description:
My most recent visit to Golden Coffee was the morning after I returned from a week-long business trip and didn't have time to pick up groceries to make my own breakfast. So I opted to give $5 to the nice family that runs this coffee shop for a scrambled egg, two sausage links, and four avocado slices (instead of hash and toast). I don't understand Cantonese, but it seemed that my request to sub avocado for hash and toast met some resistance with the chef. However, he gave in, which helped me stick to my no-carb diet.

I sat and ate my breakfast quietly while listening to the two other patrons talking at each other from across the two sides of the greasy spoon about some guy asking one of them for money. The other patron advised not signing up for a co-dependent relationship, which I silently agreed with.

The verdict: You will find me at Golden Coffee when I need to outsource breakfast on the cheap. It may not be amazing food, but it's cooked to order and saves me from having to do the dishes.
author: Tiff T.

description: Inexpensive and delicious!  I had the french toast, eggs, and coffee. I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Blake C.

description:
The only reason I hesitate to give Golden Coffee five stars is because I don't want this place to become too popular. If I lived in SF I'd prolly eat there every day.
The place is a classic counter service greasy spoon. The food is cooked quickly and cheaply and tastes good.
I like the man who cooks and the other people who serve and run the place. I feel good in there. There is something lovely about the occasional  personal touches found in the simple, clean decor.
Please never go here, I want it all to myself.
author: Peter B.

description: I had pork chops and eggs. The pork chops were juicy and tender.  They reminded me of the fried pork chops my mom used to make when we were kids.  The eggs were cooked just right.  My wife had french toast and she said it was delicious.  She is a chef with a refined pallet and she liked it.  Great job!
author: Scott S.

description: great and cute little breakfast place where you could take family and friends too. i would go again but i wake up at 3pm and they close after 2:30. yum yum in me tum tum
author: Xavier L.

description: Love me some Golden Coffee. Best diner around and super cheap. Family owned and run. Corned beef hash is the usual canned stuff but the way he cooks it is way better than anywhere else.
author: Stomparella J.

description:
Stumbled upon another great find for Breakfast! Although not much to look at, Golden Coffee is a great little diner. Seriously the best $5.00 deal for Standard Breakfast in San Francisco. 

I ordered the two eggs, served with four bacon, hash browns and toast for $5.00. You can add on additional eggs, side of pancakes or french toast. Really good, fast breakfast - just how I like it. 

The breakfast was served pretty fast, never waited over 10 minutes in the few times we came in for breakfast. The staff was very nice. I would definitely come back if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
I love a breakfast joint where I can get a quick tasty breakfast. I tend to go to diners and my expectations of ambiance are very low. Well...this place serves up a traditional breakfast quickly and made to order. No plastic eggs and turkey bacon here. 

If you look up greasy spoon (in the kindest way possible) in the dictionary you will find a picture of this place.
author: Shannon B.

description:
Cash Only

There isn't much left to say. Food is quick and easy. Plop down on the counter and order. No, the service wasn't memorable but what do you expect? At least they refilled my coffee and gave me my food.
author: Michelle C.

description: I just love this Mom & Pop place for breakfast,it's a hole in the Wall but a great one! Had breakfast here every morning since my hotel was near by.Dont me fooled my the Chinese people behind the bar that take your order  and make your breakfast for you,they make it Great every time! This place is very small so I would suggest if you are a party of 4 or more go elsewhere. It's great for solo travelers or couples.The pricing is so reasonable it's a must go to for breakfast.
author: Rachel B.

description: Yes this place is dusty, and somewhat neglected but it's not pretending to be anything that it's not. It takes you back to another time sitting around that counter. It's easy to get a spot, it's insanely reasonably priced (especially for this city), and it's truthfully really great breakfast food. What do you look for with breakfast food? Crispy bacon - check. Fluffy pancakes - check. Perfectly cooked over easy eggs - check. And it all comes from 1 guy, holding down the griddle. AND for $5.95 a plate. Obviously i'm a big fan.
author: Jenna G.

description:
This place is amazing. I almost don't want to write a review because I like it so much and want to draw less attention to it.

Definitely not a place to go if you want anything fancy, or care what the decor looks like. All that matters here is that the food is delicious. The hashbrowns are amazing, and the omelettes are even better.

The coffee isn't great, but I really could care less for that. I would go here everyday if I could.
author: Susan Z.

description: Gross kitchen and food. The bad kind of greasy. Asked for wheat toast and I got white. Asked for extra crispy hash browns got literal mush. Sad!
author: Jason S.

description: A cute little family owned place. It may look a little dated but the food is good and you can tell they all work hard. The food was fast and delicious - I highly recommend. If you want to get that authentic SF local feel then definitely come here! We ordered the the corn beef hash with eggs and the French toast with eggs.
author: Micaela B.

description:
I love this place!!!

I come here almost every single weekend when I am in town, and the service and food are both consistent. This is a no-frills breakfast spot so don't expect bottomless mimosas or lounging around for a couple of hours. I am usually in and out within 30 - 45 minutes each time. Pretty small so groups over 4 will have trouble. 

I tend to be a breakfast creature of habit and get almost the same thing every time, and they have never once messed up my order. I like to order my hash browns extra crispy and they always comply. The few times I have deviated from my norm the food has always been great. It's a total local crowd and is always full of regulars, which is a good sign.

Good ol fashioned eggs and bacon is my usual standby, but their salsa and avocado omelette is a close second. French toast is easily a fav, but their burgers and sandwiches are delish too. 

You can't get a cheaper breakfast in town! Keep in mind it IS cash only, so that is the only downside.
author: E. B.

description:
This place was great!
I am from San Diego and flew to SF for the weekend. We were trying to find a breakfast place around the area, and found this little place. Its kind of a hole in the wall, and the prices is super cheap. 
I had the corn beef hash and it was delicious!! I would definitely recommend getting it if you're a fan! The customer service was also really great, considering the place is so small that they had to be right there with you. We didn't even have to ask for refills, they would literally wait until you put your cup down from drinking and refill it right away. Overall, i will for sure come back when i fly up to visit again!
author: Jess R.

description:
Slow. Sloppy. Disorganized.

Those are the good features of the service. The food is gloppy and coffee typically terrible.
author: Seamus L.

description: I'm giving this place 5 stars because it is super cheap and also very good. Can't get any better than that!
author: Sean P.

description: This is my go-to breakfast spot when I'm in SF. It's a literal 'mom and pop' joint serving traditional breakfast items. The decor is non-existent and the place could do with a good clean, but as far as the food goes, you won't find better. The pancakes are a thousand times better than chain restaurants like IHOP or Denny's. The prices are extremely low. It's so good, I rarely consider eating anywhere else in the city for breakfast.
author: James C.

description: The only reason his place did not get 5 stars is because they do t take credit cards, we had to run across the street to the ATM. Still highly recommended though. Very inexpensive, a very nice change of pace from the $29/person buffet at the hotel. Can't go wrong with anything here, just bring cash.
author: Justin H.

description: Classic little dinner. All the standard menu items. Food isn't going to blow you away but it's definitely not bad. It's fun to sit at the counter (counter seats only) and watch your food being cooked.
author: Sam E.

description: This place is a place of dreams. I went to college in San Francisco and waking up on a Saturday and or Sunday morning and walking a few blocks over and having breakfast in damn near pajamas with my buddies is one of the things I miss most. Everytime I visit San Francisco, I go back there, the food is delicious, without trying to be too bougie. its just two old people in a room cooking up some breakfast, it tastes so homemade and is SUPER CHEAP, like $4 for a whole meal. the thing is at certain times it gets really packed and you will have to wait outside or if your inside you might feel pressured to eat fast, always go when they are about to close if you don't want this.
author: Vannessa P.

description: My kids tell me I need to learn to cook like this!  Came at 10:00am on a Wednesday.  No wait.  Got to sit at a table.  Be ready: CASH ONLY!!
author: Alexis C.

description: Delicious traditional American breakfast! This mom and pop restaurant is quaint with friendly, fast service. We had pancakes, ham, sausage, bacon, eggs, toast, and hash browns. The kids had hot chocolate and we had coffee. They have a big list of omelets on the menu as well as French toast for breakfast.  Our whole tab was $35 including the 20% tip. My 9 year old son wrote the chef a note saying how delicious everything was. They are open for lunch and have typical diner fare on the menu. They also have a small Chinese food menu. We will probably be back there!
author: Suzanne N.

description: If decor, atmosphere, and a place with a restroom is what your looking for then you will be overwhelmingly disappointed. In fact, this place is probably where the term "greasy spoon" originated! Don't expect a "welcome ya'll" either. Get past that and what you will get is extremely well priced, hot, and made to order breakfast made by locals. I don't think I could have made the 6 sausages, 4 eggs, 4 pancakes, coffee and OJ for $19.42. In fact, I felt a little guilty paying someone to cook all that at the price charged. No frills is an understatement, but it saved me from having to eat until dinner. If your adventuresome, a must try!
author: Jim M.

description: Great, cheap basic breakfast with good service. Waffles are excellent. Being from Arizona, it was nice to find an awesome, hole-in-the-wall type cafe to eat at while on vacation.
author: Max K.

description: Good traditional breakfast food . Cleanliness is borderline . Service is efficient but so little communication or customer acknowledgement it's almost comical.
author: Kevin D.

description:
I just moved nearby and found this little spot for a quick Saturday brunch. Walked in and was pretty surprised by what I saw in terms of layout and decor (minimalist) but the food was delicious. We ordered the corn beef hash and a waffle topped with strawberries and cream. I like that you get to watch the staff do everything, esp if you sit at the counter and service is very friendly! My guess is that the place is family owned, which makes this spot even more homey. 

The food is affordable, setup gets the job done, and service expectations were set transparently by the staff. The staff proactively told me that I had to wait 5 mins for the next batch of fresh coffee.

Overall great experience and a new local spot I'll be back to :)
author: Phil C.

description:
I went again today because I wanted a simple breakfast without waiting an hour somewhere. For some reason all the decent breakfast places on Nob Hill are packed with hipsters and I for one don't want to waste half a day waiting for breakfast.
I used to come to this place every weekend for years. I'll admit that as my palate evolved and bank account grew I decided to shrug this place off. I played the mad game of "find the best place" for years. Sometimes it's the simple things and places that please us the most. This is one of those places.
So I got a full, hearty breakfast with a waffle and left stuffed. Everything tasted great. It is definitely a dive but I like it. 
I think they source most of their ingredients from Costco, but so what? Costco is known for having exceptional quality so if they can use superior ingredients and pass the savings on to me, I'm all for it. 
Looking forward to getting back into my groove with this place. It's like connecting with an old friend.
author: Matt H.

description: Great food! Went here with the family for breakfast. Nice little mom and pop cafe with good food. Can't beat the price. Not a lot of seating though so I would have a back up plan in case they are busy. Definitely worth a try though.
author: Brett K.

description: Very unique place for a simple  no fuss breakfast. Fun seating at the counter, lovely service, nothing fancy but a clean place. Menu uncomplicated, I had corned beef hash and eggs and my husband had pork chops with eggs, we both cleaned our plates out, so good! Way batter then cafes on Union Square with the long lines and overpriced bland food. Oh and the coffee was perfect!
author: Monika D.

description: This place has the best greasy spoon breakfast. Everytime I come to San Francisco I eat here.. Do not expect fancy.. Do not expect it to be super clean either.. But it's such an awesome atmosphere none of that matters!! Love this place!!
author: David C.

description:
I understand the temptation to like this place  as evidenced by the many 4-star yelpers before me. This is the epitome of a hole in the wall diner; slinging cheap greasy diner fare. The problem is that the cost can't make up for slow, dispassionate service, below average food, and marginal coffee.

I really wanted to like this place, but my recommendation is to either fry a couple of eggs at home or spend a couple extra dollars per person and go to Honey Honey just a few blocks away.
author: Casey C.

description: I didn't eat here and here's why.  On my trip SF was experiencing a heat wave.  We pop in here based on Yelp reviews to find there is no AC.  We get water with one ice cube each.  The place is dirty, but the bathroom was disgusting.  It was covered in rust and water.  The soap was stuck in rust and there was no dryer or towels. I hope the staff washes their hands somewhere else.  Luckily they only take cash so we were able to bolt.
author: Courtney B.

description:
Great price for this area just outside the financial district .. worth the walk. Felt like I was back home at an L&L (can't believe I'm missing that lol). Nice Chinese people in a quaint, old-school style cafe right in the corner. Looks plain on the outside and the menu is simple but they make great-tasting, cheap (especially for the area) All-American breakfast food!

I'm definitely coming here again when I'm in town.
author: Tania L.

description: Well what can I say. I was duped by the large majority of good reviews. I don't understand why this places has a high rating. I mean it's cheap, but come on people have you not tasted good american breakfast in your life?! I'm from out of town and went based on yelp reviews the moment I walked in I knew there was something wrong. Yet I decided I would be humble and give a shot. Boy was I wrong I got french toast with two scrambled eggs and a side of hash browns. The French toast was by far the most disgusting thing I've ever had in my life. They tasted old and smelled old, God I can still taste it yuck. The same goes for the eggs. Hash browns were under cooked. Avoid this place at all cost.
author: Speedy C.

description:
This Midwestern girl is in love with a greasy spoon breakfast bar with a side-by-side Chinese lunch menu. That's probably par for the course here on the west coast, but it's new to me and I almost want to stay for lunch if I didn't have a million other places to try within walking distance. 
I ordered the ham omelet with Jack cheese (duh! Why didn't I add avocado? I'm in freakin' California!) and I also got my usual wheat toast, which was also a San Francisco mistake...the dude next to me got sour dough. Another DOH!
This tiny diner has an exposed grill, but the cook rings a bell when the order is up nonetheless. Adorable! I also love hearing Katy Perry, Lady Gaga, and all the latest dance hits of the day at a respectable volume while I dine. What can I say? I like to chair dance at breakfast. 
Portions are huge, so come hungry or bring a friend with a similar palate. Also, it's cash only, but the ATM across the street at Yogi's saves the day. 
Although my final thought really has nothing to do with the establishment itself, I must note that the dude across from me looks just like Morrissey. Nice.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: This place is AMAZING! Awesome service and excellent food, not to mention the price is unheard of in San Fran. We have been here for breakfast every morning since we found it. Omelettes and French toast are great!
author: Aubrey R.

description:
Don't let the rusty spoon look scare you. This is the most delicious inexpensive brunch place ever created. I used to live right around the corner and would come here every weekend for almost 2 years. Even though I've moved from Oakland to Berkeley to Pacifica, I've still made a point to stop here whenever possible. 

2 eggs 4 bacons is a classic, but definitely try the jack avocado and salsa omelette. The basic coffee is so amazing as well. Also, if you go enough there are some interesting characters that frequent it. Enjoy!!
author: Jenni W.

description: Ate here yesterday for the first time and oh wow it's amazing! Looks like a major No Go zone but dont judge a book by it's cover! Service excellent, food is delicious and the price is so so cheap it's scary!
author: Ailbhe B.

description: Simple, no frills, good breakfast food. Good prices and the counter staff are nice. It's a great spot to have downstairs from my apartment. Order in or take it to go!
author: Thomas K.

description: The food here was amazing and affordable. It's a little hole in the wall and they serve you more than enough for one person. I can definitely say I will be coming back when I'm in town.
author: Ilean S.

description:
We love this place!! The food is delicious and the people
Are a delight.
Favorite local diner!!
author: Emily G.

description:
This is one of those places that will make your trip to San Francisco great!

The ambiance is a traditional coffee shop.  Simple.  Understated.  Perfect.  

There were very few tourists amongst the regulars that lined the bar top.  Businessmen and students sitting shoulder to shoulder, eating breakfast, drinking coffee out of ceramic mugs.  The gentleman next to me was even nice enough to loan me their copy of the Wall Street Journal. 
The food was delicious!  The food matched the ambiance: simple, understated, perfect.  It is exactly what you would expect from viewing the exterior.  They had all the classic coffee shop breakfast favorites, eggs however you like, bacon, sausage, omelets, cereal, bagels, waffles, pancakes, biscuits & gravy.  

If I wake up in SF you can bet I'll be heading to Golden Coffee Shop as soon as wake up.
author: Brandon S.

description:
Just checked out of our hotel room and we were hungry, so we came to Golden Coffee Shop. We ordered bacon, eggs, and waffles. Waffles are bomb! 

Service was decent.

The coffee was awesome. I would definitely come back just for the coffee.
author: Art R.

description:
Cash only. Very very limited seating. Do not be in a hurry if you come here. 

There is one cook and one waitress. The waitress was on top of it, but there is only one of her. We waited to get a seat, we waited to give our order, we waited to get coffee, we waited to get our food, we waited to pay. I felt like I was waiting the entire time.
