Golden Coffee Shop doesn't have the charm of many other diners in the city, but it is a reliable, dependable workhorse that will help you get started in the morning.  Keeps me coming back.
author: Paul B.

description:
This place is the coolest. A real neighborhood joint, incredibly cheap, with a fabulous atmosphere, something out of a movie in it's incredible simplicity. The service is odd at times I admit, you will get your breakfast in installments, the elderly gentleman serving you appears confident behind his counter, but almost like a fish out of water elsewhere, a lot of bowing and apologetic gestures. Very entertaining.

I love the food , the omelets are great and richly filled. Get the one with Avocado! The hash browns are savory and not too greasy. The coffee sucks, but hey, that's part of the typical American diner experience , no? This is a place you will either hate or love wholeheartedly. An original. I for one love it. It's part of what makes me feel connected to my neighborhood.
author: Sketchbook S.

description: This is one of the best breakfast spot we encountered. Magic relaxed atmosphere.
author: Streetart M.

description:
This greasy spoon serves everyone from the academy of art kids, working class joes, and occasional crack heads. 

On New Years day, many people had just crawled out of their holes from the debauchery of the night before into this fairly small space. Some people even had their new years leisure suits from the night before. The older Chinese man was very nice and took our orders promptly. It seemed like him and two other women (one his wife?) were the only ones serving at the shop today so their service was a little slow, but nothing to complain about. I had delicious sausages with a crisp hash brown and scrambled egg. For the price I paid (about $6.50 after tax and tip) it was certainly a bargain in this area.

Although this place is fairly cheap (you will be full for under $8 after tax and tip), it will not leave your stomach in knots (unlike some other nearby places *cough* New Village Cafe).

The breakfast items were very basic and they also offer chinese food after 11am and there is only seating for about 25 max.

This is a no-frills diner and a decent place to go if you live a few blocks away.

Tip: Come here before the 'hipster' (Academy of Art students living on their parents dimes) swarm around 12 on a Saturday or Sunday (or post-holiday) morning.
author: Anthony K.

description:
I love simple greasy spoon breakfast joints.

Here's an example of what $15 can buy 2 people: 
-2 coffees
-2 oj
-4 pieces bacon
-3 sausages
-6 eggs
-toast
-english muffin
-2 hash browns- extra crispy
-Tip

No fuss+ no wait + lots of copies of the funnies laying around = perfect weekend breakfast joint :)
author: Gabrielle J.

description:
Best 2 eggs over easy I've had, and definitely top value compared to most of the joints I've found in SF. Perfect for a no-fuss breakfast without frilly prices. 
Come here fairly regularly and it's a good experience every time.
Love the random classical music playing when it's the two older gentlemen during the weekdays. Found that there's more rock/pop going on when the younger guy helps out on Saturdays.
author: Jay K.

description: So, I don't really understand anything of what the server is saying, but we do communicate-- eggs, bacon, and hash brows, luckily are a universal language. Golden coffee is golden perfect for a huge hung over day, or for a nice brunch.  The hash browns and the bacon avocado omelet are my favorite. This place is the jam and I loves this local shop :)
author: Angela R.

description:
Perfect bacon and eggs joint for the morning after a harsh night out. 

3 reasons:

-The food has the right amount of fat to settle down my hangover stomach.

-The prices are my budget's BFF (under $5 for a whole meal)

-Not glamourous for a bit, everyone sits around the counter, facing each other but minding their own business. great, cause i don't wanna talk to anyone.

i love the asian crew that runs the place. they must think that i look like shit as my natural look...but they close at 4pm everyday, so they'll never see me BEFORE i go out!  What a shame...
author: Margie B.

description: Awesome hot chocolate, coffee, and hash browns. Bacon and eggs are the bomb! I give this hole on the wall five stars for it's quick service, affordable prices, and yummy breakfast!!
author: Adrianna R.

description: I should ding them a star for being grimy around the edges, but the breakfast is so good and so cheap, I just can't bring myself to do it. Locals pack the place, and you'll get a right and proper American breakfast for very little dough. Cash only, BTW
author: Jennie M.

description:
This is what a breakfast spot should be. A counter and a griddle and a coffee pot, fast and hot and cheap--no frills. There are like three tables which seat two people each and 15 seats at the counter. Quick turnover so don't worry about the wait if there is one.

My last trip was breakfast for two with coffee. Bill=$13.77. In 2009. In San Francisco.

You could transport Golden Coffee back in time 60 years completely unaltered from its current state, and it'd the place with the full hat rack where a fella took his dame to get a hot cup of joe.

I'd surely give this place 5 stars if I could prevent myself from comparing it to my beloved Pork Store (Haight St. version, the mission P.Store can get to steppin').
author: Trav W.

description: This grungy little diner is right across the street from me. I can just roll out of bed and go get my coffee, strawberry waffle, and scrambled egg with tons of hot sauce and bacon. Please don't ever go away Golden Coffee. You're the reason I have become too lazy to make breakfast for myself anymore.
author: Kat A.

description:
The first meal I ate in 2009 was at Golden Coffee Shop. Based on what I ate, I'd say the year is off to a solid start...

This is probably the most straightforward, no-nonsense, no-frills diner I've visited. But I'm not a fan of places that try too hard, so I got on fine.

Decent breakfast basics and it's so cheap I can't give less than 4 stars.

PS: Only two small tables tucked in the corners near the windows and the rest of the seating is at the counter -- so it's not the best place for a large group.
author: Annee T.

description: Nice American breakfast with a Chinese touch. Reliable and economical. They are nice and serves great. Ilike their pancake menu with all American Hashbrown.
author: Pach P.

description:
This might have been the longest journey to breakfast ever. It started the day prior, roughly noon, after waking up from the next to last night of the Winter Music Conference in Miami. We spent the day dancing, and the night dancing, and went straight from Armin Van Buuren to the airport. Words have yet to be invented for how hungry I was when I stepped off the plane.....

.....which led me to Golden Coffee and their very good, very cheap, very efficient operation in the 'loin. The players:

Dad: Cooks. Makes breakfast a reality.
Mom: Helps cook. Provides utensils and silverware. Makes a mean waffle.
Son: Greeter. Seats you. Takes money.

Three people serving about thirty people. I was one of them, and it might have been my "i've never felt hunger like this before" condition, but I totally loved my waffle. Some eggs were tossed in on the side (whites were no problem, but there was plenty of oil used), and all was devoured in about 5 minutes. I paid about a dollar per minute for the food - an outstanding deal.

24 hours after my day began, I left with broad smile that only could have been prompted by a very satisfied stomach.

Or it could have been the positive vibes from a weeks worth of inspiring dancing.

Or both.
author: Jason B.

description:
Who would have thought one of the cheapest and least pretentious breakfast spots in the city would be up on Nob Hill?

Typical greasy spoon fare (eggs, omelettes, sammies, etc.) and a few Asian dishes are all you get...but sometimes that's all you need. I'd personally rather pay $4.50 for a basic plate than throw down $9 for some elitist's idea of a "gourmet scramble" with a sprinkling of spices on top. Shit, bring your own paprika and save yourself the $3 surcharge for 25 cents worth of extra seasoning!

At this tiny corner spot, there are only two tables and a horseshoe-shaped Formica counter at which to sit. Everything about the place reeks of mid-century luncheonette. It's so retro you could imagine Tom Waits taking the stool next to yours without batting an eye.

Too bad it closes at 4 o'clock. No "Nighthawks at the Diner" found here.

Otherwise, Golden Coffee is the perfect alternative to spendy breakfasts.
author: John G.

description:
i think this is one of the city's hidden gems. it's good old-fashioned breakfast (or chinese, if you want lunch) food cooked right and priced so cheap it's absurd. when i want my fix of eggs, hashbrowns, bacon and pancakes (and i'm in the city) THIS IS MY SPOT. 

the old chinese people that own this place are very nice but not much for talking. i think this is mostly because they don't speak english very well. 

i wish they would find a bigger restaurant though! it would be filled all the time! 

and if you get a chance, like this place on facebook!! :)
author: Alyssa L.

description: This is place is super fast and the food does not disappoint.  I had the 2 eggs, 2 bacon and 2 pancakes.  Food was cheap and did its job.  Better than the foo foo places in Mission (yeah its good but should not break the bank).  For 2 people the total was $11 better than a McMeal.
author: Drew C.

description:
Even though the menu has two full pages of breakfast items to pick from, I went with the third page = Chinese food. I ordered chicken chow mein. Huge plate full for about $5 was a great deal. My friend ordered the omelet with avocado, jack and salsa -- looked delicious. 

Place is somewhat small, but the service is incredible. Golden Coffee is family owned and run so they take pride in good food and service. =)
author: Shastina O.

description:
Delicious casul little dinner on the corner of Sutter and Leavenworth.  I live right down the street so I frequent this dinner quite often.  You can't beat the prices here and there is a great selection of breakfast and lunch foods.  Most people come for the breakfast.  You can get a great meal for $5 or less.  Burgers are good too, so are the sandwiches and the chinese food.  

The owner is a man named Jin who remembers faces and orders very well.  All food is cooked right there on the spot in front of you and the service is quick.  Great place for a sit down mean without having to pay a sit down price.  I give the food a 9, the service an 8 and the overall value and experience here a 10.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Been there couple of times because they're cheap, the food was so so, but I was disappointed today.
Have not much money and hungry I ordered a  bbq pork fried rice to go, and was really surprise when i'm about to eat. The portion was really small, even for my standard and the fried rice was bland.
It's just my luck maybe (...yup, somehow April is always the worst month for me) or just bad lunch decision.
Minus one for the portion.
Minus one for the taste.
Minus one for making my day (or month) more worst =P.
One star for the service.
One star because I have to.
So two stars for now.
author: toto h.

description:
This is a coffee shop; it has featureless rose painted walls and poorly upholstered stools surrounding a central Formica island. It is a coffee shop in the classic sense, simple greasy spoon food and mediocre caffeine served up without frills. They even have Joe's Special, the historic breakfast food of San Francisco.  Prices are also rather cheap.

There are eggs, burgers, sweetish pancakes, hash and sausages. No Salmon or Mimosas on offer.  This isn't a brunch spot, and if one is okay with all that, Golden Coffee is frank and consistent, food is benign and service quick.
author: Gustie L.

description:
I giveth thee 5 stars because there ain't no reason to give you less.

The first time I went here was about 4-5 years ago and I have always remembered it, I know I loved it, but I'd never had the opportunity to return, until 2 weeks ago.

Oh hangover, how I hate thee, but without you I would miss out on so many things. I crawled off of a couch and managed to blurt out the word COFFEE, my friends says to me "golden coffee" I blurt back WATER, he says "Breakfast." I had corn-beef hash, I had never had corn-beef hash before in my entire life, in the last 2 weeks I have had it at least 3 times but nothing is as good as it was at Golden Coffee. And cheap...man alive is this place cheap.
author: Laura D.

description:
I think the manager of this place should start a Mortal Kombat style duel to the death with the owner of Han's coffee shop across the street.

They are right across the street from eachother and they both play the "Greasy Breakfast Diner With a Side of Chinese Food" card.

Almost as good as the wide selection of "Fried Chicken and Donut" stores that pepper Oakland.

====Update, Raised to 4 stars====

I visit Golden Coffee weekly, and the breakfast here is consistently awesome so I've bumped it up to 4 stars.  

I find it to be slightly cleaner and slightly higher quality than Han's Coffee.  The U shaped counter is also neat, and there's more of a chance of striking up a conversation with the other locals.

The coffee still sucks, but for $1.15, who really cares?
author: Rocco B.

description: Staying in nearby hotel, so I checked it out. Good food and prices.
author: Ruben L.

description:
For the price you just cant beat this place.  I dont know any other place where you can get two eggs, bacon, toast, and hashbrowns for 5 dollars.

Goldend Coffee looks abit dirty and old from the outside and on the inside you will find a older, clean, classic diner, with an all chinese staff that doesnt mess around. 

The ingridients are simple and fresh.....try it out!  They also have fresh squeezed OJ.....hey....its Odwalla!
author: Justin H.

description:
They're sweet and friendly people. They make good food. The seats are super comfortable. Sometimes I wish it was on the other side of the street, so it wouldn't be so dark, but I still love it.

ps. It's cheap!
author: Aleksander S.

description: Food is good for what it is, but it's nothing mind-blowing. Just very basic things you could make at home in minutes. The staff doesn't speak English well, but seem nice enough. Very slow service. Also cramped seating. Would not be difficult to find a better place to eat in the same area.
author: Ben B.

description:
Delicious, Amazing, Treats!!!!!!

Best CHEAP breakfast anywhere. Get the HASH BROWNS!!!! 

Run by my favorite asian family. Hello they also serve chinese food!

Tips:
-Sit at the bar...service is faster.
-Come before 330
-don't come in big groups

Downfalls:
-They only give you one ice cube in the water cups...it melts quickly. (When you get two cubes you know you're a favorite....i'm still working on it.)
-They dont have ranch dressing  :(
author: Jen C.

description: Straight up, flat top griddle cooked eggs, hash browns, cakes, toast. Simply done- the way they should be. No pretentious breakfast here. I am so glad we found this place. Great down home breakfast, and very inexpensive.
author: Eric K.

description: What small space Golden Coffee Shop encompasses.  Nothing fancy about this place but he food is good and it is cheap.  I like that you are able to see the cook making the meals and it seems like it is a family run business.  God and relatively quick place for a breakfast.
author: Blake B.

description: I feel like I'll probably come here again but I'm gonna have to say that I like Hans more for portion size but the food here tasted a lot better.
author: Maryneth K.

description:
One of the best things about living in the Tendernob is the plethora of good cheap eats in the area.  Finding a solid no-nonsense breakfast joint can be tough these days but the TN has a few and this might just be my favorite.

Five bucks for two eggs, 4 strips of bacon, hash browns and toast sounds like a damn good deal to me!  The hash browns are just right, (slightly crispy and golden on top, lightly done and softer on the bottom), the toast is done just right, and the eggs are done just the way you like 'em (for me that's over-medium, yolks not too runny but not too firm). Very classic old-school diner space, too, a tiny box of a room with a square bar around the cooking area, where a very nice asian family works very hard to keep everyone happy.  Watching the older gentleman singlehandedly and expertly juggle a never-ending stream of egg, bacon, sausage and hash brown orders on one grill is a thing of beauty.  I also enjoy the very diverse crowd that turns up here, a cool mix of locals that seem to have been going here forever and tourists spilling in from the Union Square hotels.  Check it out!
author: Mike J.

description:
A true greasy spoon if I ever saw one.  
The food is SO CHEAP it brings a blissful smile to my face! :) 

The only reason I didn't rate it higher--the pancakes. very thick and doughy; ya know, the kind where you drown them in syrup and it sops it all up--but still tastes dry? I would have been wise to go with the omlettes (that pretty much everyone else was eating) that looked AMAZING along with the freshly grated hash browns. 

It blows my mind that such a little kitchen can produce the amount of food that I saw--and they are very quick! 

FYI Greasy Spoon = Ca$h Only so be ready or scramble across the street to on of the ATMS
author: Niambi M.

description: We visit every time we are in SF. An awesome breakfast for two under $20. The comradarie at the counter is all part of the experience. Just love this place. It is a MUST.
author: m w.

description: I am giving the pancakes I ate 3 stars because they were delicious. The egg whites I had were covered in butter so I put them aside. Also I expected a coffee shop to have different coffee options. They only have regular coffee. The service was friendly though! Very small place with limited seating.
author: Jul T.

description:
Golden Coffee is a dive but they sure know how to make a great breakfast. Scrambled Eggs with BBQ pork... French Toast, Waffles, omelettes... from corn beef hash to poached eggs, these guys know how to make it right, no frills just thrills.

Serve 'em up...
author: Aimee C.

description:
Great way to start the day:  great food, large selection, fast service, cheap prices.  

I enjoy the atmosphere the best:  lots of bar seating, free newspapers, very large windows.  It's a very comfortable place to go by yourself.
author: Eric L.

description:
Ok, Han's versus Golden?

For me Golden is the spot to go for a basic American breakfast.

First of all, you cannot discuss Golden Coffee without acknowledging that it is a living museum of a 1940s coffee shop. It is fascinating and admirable that it has not been renovated back to its prime. The elegant curves of the counter are balanced by the horribly plain walls. You can just stare at the place and imagine another time. Han's cannot match this experience.You are eating at an unrestored museum--special.
The food? Han's offers a far wider menu but I fell for Golden's portion control and simple aesthetic. There is less food at Golden but in more pleasing form and in (thankfully) smaller portions.
Obviously Han's has the odd bathroom attraction but Golden offers the creepy stairs to the dish washing area.
Hey, both places offer the obvious fare but Golden just does simple better. If you want the more unusual you gotta go across the street.
An added bonus is the affable, low-key energy of the guy running Golden. If you need to be calmed down from the City life, then spend 30 minutes in his company--afforadble therapy.
author: Sean G.

description:
This is one of the better greasy spoons i've been to.  I'm tellin you this:  Get the waffle with eggs and bacon or sausage. 

or at least I will :P

The counter seats are uncomfortable.
author: Matt N.

description: Great Breakfast spot with a cool thing going on with the bar... like the light in the place on sunny days... super for the cost.
author: Matthew S.

description:
There's something about this place that has the perfect combination that makes it special...

* cheap
* good breakfast food, but nothing extraordinary
* old diner feel, just sit around the U-shaped counter top and order your food.
* fast service

The perfect place to stumble to if you just woke up and need food ASAP.
author: Jose R.

description: Just throwin' down the 5-star for my favorite neighborhood diner. The reviews say it all.
author: Zack G.

description: Never do they forget one thing and the food is so yummy and simple.  Hash browns and American Cheese omelette are my pick every time and that is all I have to say about that.  Yuuuuuummmy.
author: D B.

description: Great hole in the wall. San Fran's version of a Waffle House. Comfortable place for eating solo. They keep the sports page behind the counter, if your phone is dying and you want to read highlights.
author: B S.

description: I absolutely love this place. I adore the simplicity, prices and the consistent yumminess of the food. I've been here so many times and have never left disappointed. Its definitely not a glamour spot, but that adds to the charm. If you want good breakfast, good people watching and cheap prices, then this is the place to go.
author: Claudia P.

description:
Pretty much the cheapest breakfast fair in San Francisco.
It's simple, basic and works wonders on a hangover.
Service is pleasant.
No complaints.
author: Julia T.

description: this place is funny. down and dirty cheap awesome breakfast. love the big wrap around counter and the old asian guy cookin it up. breakfast is the best meal.
author: Sally f.

description:
Great place if you want a home cooked meal for CHEAP. 

The boyfriend and I came here on Saturday morning. I got the Denver omelet (which comes out more like a scramble then an omelet) with a side of fries (I don't like hash browns) and 2 pieces of toast. The boy ordered a tall stack or 3 pancakes which came with his choice of 4 sausages or bacon strips.

With tax and a 20% tip we paid....$13...TOTAL!!! 

Yes seriously! Whoever said you can't eat and pay rent in the City never stopped into the Golden Coffee Shop.

P.S. They also have Chinese-American dishes (like broccoli beef over rice) if you prefer to go that route.
author: Rana A.

description:
Its a great place to have coffee with friends and enjoy  affordable breakfast.

-Mack
author: Mckenzy G.

description:
This is a pleasantly straightforward place to grab breakfast. I had the corned beef hash with two eggs, and the grand total came to $6. I was pretty satisfied, but people with bigger appetites will probably want to take advantage of the very low prices by ordering a bit more.

As far as the taste goes, I was impressed. My scrambled eggs were made just how I like them (a little fluffy but not too light, not wet/yolky but not rubbery/dry either). The corned beef tasted good too, although it wasn't the strongest I've ever had. That's probably a good thing if you're overwhelmed by the flavor of corned beef elsewhere as I occasionally am.

Even though I was very content with my order, I was watching the cook prepare dishes for other people, and I was a bit jealous of whoever ordered the french toast, bacon, and scrambled eggs. The french toast and bacon both looked thick and amazingly good, and I already said that the scrambled eggs were made just how I like them. I will definitely be returning, and when I do, this is exactly what I will be ordering.

I'm not going to knock them on their atmosphere too much, but I'm not going go give them much praise for it either. It's simple and I felt comfortable, but it's not really the most charming place on earth. So in other words, if you're a tourist or just want something a little more magical, then go elsewhere.

If you're having one of those mornings where you want to treat yourself by going out for brunch but don't really need to impress yourself or don't feel like spending more than a few bucks, than this place is what you're looking for.
author: James L.

description:
This is the kind of place that I would normally walk right by.  It is a tiny little hole in the wall and the smell of grease from the inside wafts out onto the street.  I stopped for a few of reasons.  1) It is half a block from my house. 2) There are always people in here...and that is usually the sign of good food 3) The greasy smell was exactly what my hangover was looking for.

I have to say, this place did not disappoint.  I usually keep it simple...eggs with hash browns and toast.  The price can't be beat...without meat but with a cup of coffee the whole meal comes to just about $5 and that includes tip!  Really, you can't go wrong.  The hash browns (and the siracha sauce they have to go one them) are great....crispy on the outside but they still have a potato-ness about them.  Mmmm...

I give them minus one star because for a place that mentions coffee in their name, the stuff they serve is pretty awful.
author: Julie P.

description:
Thank you again Yelpers for another dining experience not to be missed.  What a dive,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, WE LOVED IT!

Moi
author: Dave L.

description: For cheap, hole in the wall, American breakfast, you cannot beat Golden Coffee.
author: Addie B.

description: A friend discovered this about a year ago.  If you want a good breakfast, this is the place.  The serene, balletic movements of the staff is a perfect way to start the day.  Never had a bad meal there.  Good food, prepared in a home cooked style.  A real favorite.
author: James H.

description: The food was worth the wait!  Make sure you bring someone you can really talk to when you go because the wait gets a little long just with the one dad cooking.  Plus, go to support them and to sit at the rectangular counter.
author: Christine K.

description: It's mind-boggling to me that this place gets the good reviews it does .... it is filthy and I don't think the griddle has been cleaned in years, so not only does everything taste the same, it all tastes like rancid oil!  I suppose if you only have $4 for breakfast and there is no McDonald's around, or have a massive hangover that just calls for any kind of greasy food to help you get over it, it will do (which would explain all the old neighborhood alkies there first thing in the morning) .... But really, people, do you want to put this rancid stuff inside your body??  There are so many better options in the neighborhood such as Sweet Woodruff and Farm:Table (even Han's, the coffee shop directly across the street, uses much fresher ingredients, is cleaner, and is not grossly greasy).  [And did I mention the neighbor who told me a few weeks ago that a cockroach fell from the ceiling right into her eggs when she was having breakfast here?  She was sitting at one of the tiny tables, so look out above if you sit there!]
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Saturday morning.  Hurting.  Shouldn't have had the 6th vodka soda.  10am.  Pick up the paper.  Walk in to Golden Coffee.  Greasy spoon.  SImple menu.  Low prices.  VERY friendly staff.  Perfect way to start a late morning. 

On a lazy Saturday (or Sunday), there isn't a better way to start the day.
author: A. S.

description:
oh my gosh. two words. pancake sandwich.

two fried eggs, two slices of bacon and two big, fluffy pancakes. assembled yourself, according to your liking.

usually i don't like ordering stuff like this when i go out since i could make it for myself fairly easily. but fuck it, this shit is FIVE DOLLARS. even my severe budgetary constraints as of late are down with this place.

greasy food cures my mild-to-moderate hangovers. cheap greasy food like this, i'll eat after a dead sober night and be thrilled.
author: Jane P.

description: This is an old fashioned greasy spoon but with great priced egg plates with hash browns, pancakes,bacon. This is not some FOO FOO San Francisco place where you can get some fresh fruit and a mound of french toast for $18!!!  Try $5 breakfast. We loved it.
author: SJ O.

description: Cheap, clean, fast and ok to good food.
author: Dan S.

description: This place is great for a quick bite to eat. Very inexpensive. Hash browns were great! Not the nicest place to look at but I'm not picky. It was cheap and good. If you're looking for a place in the city that has cheap good food this is your place. It was also walking distance from our Hostel which was perfect!
author: Sheila P.

description: I like this joint because it's cheap and they serve up classic diner breakfast. You can get really good pancakes and waffles, eggs to order, hashbrowns, and even Chinese food - which is pretty good. You can get a glass of OJ for 1.95 (odwalla!) I hate this joint because the corned beef hash, at first bite is comforting, but then you realize you're eating out of a can. And you have to wait for the douchebag sitting with two empty seats on either sides of him to be done eating so you and your team can sit together. Also, the takeout tastes like shit.
author: Y K.

description:
2 eggs poached, 4 strips of bacon, 2 pieces of toast, half a plate  of potato slivers (whatever that's called) + 1 glass of oj  - good oj! - $6.75  can we say bargain?

sleepy party of town, totally relaxed environment - i haven't seen an attitude there yet -, mainly 'bar like' seating....

it's all good (tm)
author: mof m.

description: There is nothing fancy about Golden Coffee Shop, it's an old-school breakfast joint & there are no frills or suprises. We just moved to the area and wanted some traditional american breakfast on the cheap and this was it. Its older, but clean and the service is pretty good. The prices are dirt cheap...I got a waffle & 2 eggs for $5 - I think our total bill was about $15 and the portions are pretty generous. Sure, there are times when I feel like something more upscale for breakfast but really breakfast at its heart is easy and delicious. I'm a fan of Golden Coffee Shop - I'm sure we'll be back soon.
author: Kimberly R.

description: Cheap, cheerful, and good.  Crispy, melt-in-your mouth bacon.  Fluffy-crispy hash browns.  Thick mugs of good, hot coffee.  Just what you want from a diner.  Be aware though that they only take cash and there's no bathroom.
author: Thaya K.

description: Had the Joe's special and pancakes.  good food and low price.  for those travelling with elderly guests, there is limited seating with chair backs (two tables of four)  and more bar seating
author: Kris B.

description:
Fantastic food. Fried eggs are fabulous, as is the crispy bacon, not to mention the home made pancakes. T

This is the most unpretentious place imaginable, but the food is truly great!

The two guys working at the caffe are polite and friendly and the atmosphere is great.
author: Jovan b.

description:
fast, easy, and cheap! 

A great breakfast for $5.00~kind of unheard of in San Francisco.

The #6 & #5 
as well the 2 buttermilk pancakes.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Want a quick, filling, tasty, get your money's worth, no b.s., traditional breakfast? Look no further. Come to Golden to share the most important meal of the day with likeminded people who aren't looking for a six dollar mimosa, but rather some eggs, bacon, browns and coffee on the cheap.
author: Alex A.

description: Hands down the best, simple, and homemade fantastic breakfast joints in San Fran. Cheap food, warm service, so so so gooood!
author: prasanthi p.

description:
i used to live across the street from golden coffee and i miss it!!!

this place is no fuss, no frill, just great homestyle breakfast (and chinese dishes). I think what really builds the atmosphere here is that you can see everyone in the cafe and its no pressure... everyone is just chowing down to their awesome food. I usually got the corned beef hash while my boyfriend always got a sausage & cheese omelet. our food always hit the spot and i think the fact that the older man was cooking on this greasy beautiful flattop grill added to the flavor! i swear that thing probably has had years of fried bacon, butter, potatoes and everything else stored in the crevices of this flattop! seriously worth hitting up if you're in the neighborhood and looking for some great unpretentious food. 

ps: chow mein rocks here too.. just make sure you dont get there too late--sometimes they run out of fresh noodles!!
author: Sandy H.

description: This place was exactly what I expected.  A fairly greasy breakfast of a Denver omelet and hash browns cooked in front of you quickly.  To be honest I was very hung over and the coffee and plentiful amounts of butter was just what the doctor ordered.  Was about as cheap as other similar places, but was very tasty.  If I was staying in the vertigo hotel for longer I would have made a return trip for sure.
author: Jerad D.

description: MMM! This place has the best breakfasts in San Francisco. I personally like the eggs, hash with rice. Amazing. They should print up some menus for the customers though.
author: Robert W.

description: Awsome greasy hangover cure food, fast, delish, nothing extraordinary but for a $5 breakfast who's to complain????
author: rachel b.

description: This place is rad! I have eaten here for breakfast, lunch and depending if I get there before it closes, dinner all in one day! And you can eat there for around $5 each time. Its great. Also, they really get to know you and what you like, whether you prefer coke over Pepsi and yes, they do carry both. I used to eat there almost every day before I had to move to Sacramento, then I went back about a year later and they all asked me how Sacramento is, even the cook which I have never talked to nor did I tell anyone there where I was moving to! Word must get around, its like family there.
author: Morgan P.

description:
Everyone is familiar with the concept of a machine that just "runs on time".  That phrase makes me think of a German made clock --- hand made, oozing craftsmanship with its cranks running smoothly in the background.

Inside of "Golden Coffee" on the corner of Leavenworth and Sutter, that is exactly what you will find.  

The man that took my order was probably in his 60's, and OK with the fact that he is still working because he is obviously just doing what he loves.  I ordered water (it was a long night) and a coffee with an English muffin and corned beef hash with 2 eggs scrambled.  The man wrote my order down and then took down my friend's order (who is in town from Indiana, just visiting SF for 24 hours) and passes the slip over to the cook at the back of the restaurant.

Noticing a strange kink in my back that is starting to form as I try to sit completely upright (as Leavenworth is a very sloped st. and things aren't always balanced or level) I look over at this man who very calmly opens up the freezer to use his tongs and grab 2 ice cubes for my water.  I think to myself, "ah... very nice execution --- I don't want your fingers touching my ice" and then the man to my right finishes his breakfast, gets his bill, pays with a 20, and walks off with his exact change.  He didn't leave a single dollar for a tip and my jaw almost hit the ground.  I immediately wonder how it is possible that the people of the food service industry have not completely revolted out of intolerance for people like this --- having to take orders all day and remain pleasant - so I decide I will make up for this man's insolence and reward the establishment with a handsome tip when I go to cash out.

The food shows up, and it is glorious.  The portions are healthy and the "chef" is obviously proud of his work standing there nodding his head (he is the kind of guy that you can just tell has some sort of release in life.  He hits the gym after work and practices Karate or something on a routine basis and probably has one hell of a left hook).  

Unlike a lot of the more popular breakfast / brunch places of the city, there is plenty of room to sit at the bar like table with chairs bolted to the ground and look out the window onto the street and people watch while you eat and soak in a Saturday mid-morning of a calm, California climate.

If you are in Lower Knob Hill and looking for a good clean breakfast joint, I recommend that you check out Golden Coffee.  The Golden reference is (or can be in my opinion) a direct correlation to the service and experience you will have inside.  

Sure, it is just a place to get a meal (one of a thousand in the city) but in this place, they go that extra mile to keep a smile on your face.  

Go, check it out and become what I will be after today --- a repeat customer...
author: Benjamin G.

description: Been going here for years and never left disappointed or still hungry.  The staff is wonderful and the bacon is extra crispy.  It's about half the price of Mel's diner and a whole lot better.
author: Eric G.

description: Your typical dive-cafe-type breakfast place packed with locals and visitors alike!  This small diner serves up some greasy treats for super cheap! A great place to go by yourself or with a friend.
author: Scott G.

description:
Went there this morning.  

I think some of the folks that have written poor reviews for the place were expecting it to be something it is not.  However, I opted to follow the advice of many of said they loved it.

Service was fast and efficient, and did I mention that the prices were great?  Food was good, hot, and tasty.

Would greatly recommend to those travelers wanting some local flavor or who want to skip the hotel breakfast for something better (and cheaper).
author: Tom T.

description: The food is cheap, simple, and simply good.  It was the first meal I wanted after coming back from London last year, where on the whole the food was not only expensive but also horrible.  I have to admit the shop does look a bit of a shithole, but it's mine, and I love it.
author: CAKE E.

description: when i'm too lazy to make own breakfast, i come here.  1 egg, toast, a good serving of hashbrowns is only $3 bucks.  It's nothing fancy, but it's exactly what it's supposed to be.
author: Alan N.

description: Great traditional breakfast. None of the douche bags that fill most of the rest of this city dine here... yes, there are actually a few normal people in San Fran... Breakfast for $5.50. Do it.
author: E S.

description: I feel like I am at a b-team United Nations meeting when I eat here. With that, nothing beats Golden coffee. This nob-loin staple is unbeatable when it comes to late morning eats. There is something to be said about a place where you may never here a word from your server, but still get great service and a quick, cheap meal. You can get toast, two eggs, bacon, hash browns and coffee for about 6 bucks, plus you get to watch all the other fellow hungoverians slump over there meals and talk about the former nights debochery. Don't dare mention the more populated Hans across the street either, or be prepared to take flak from me, and others that consider Golden a much better choice.
author: Matt M.

description:
Great.  I love the not so greasy, greasy spoon classic diner food.  Sitting around a giant counter with only two tables crammed in the corner may not appeal to diners.  

However, observing the owner methodically crack eggs and stir fry Chinese Noodles, you know the food is good before you even taste it.

Try the sparse, but great Chinese food menu as an alternative to you usual Chinese.  Better than the Nob Hill Grill, Hahn's and most of the other breakfast type places in the area.

I recommend highly.
author: The P.

description:
great breakfast food all day
their waffles arent the best
love the pancakes and french toast!
nice family, fast service, no pressure
good alternative to dottie's insanely long line
author: Deka M.

description: Could this place be any sweeter? It's the perfect little hole in the wall joint...the food is GREAT, and it's super cheap. I've gotta say that the omelet with jack cheese, mushrooms, tomato and onions has got to be my favorite...um, i don't know...their pancakes are freakin' good too...well, whatever you choose, it's going to be like $3...that's right...$3, no typo there....
author: Jennifer M.

description: This place is small but it packs a big punch!  Be aware that it's small - there are only two tables, the rest of the seating is at the small counter.  The service is fast and friendly - from what I can tell, it's a family run business, with the father as the cook, son as waiter, and mother as the washer.  The portions are huge and tasty.  This no-frills diner is a great place for a lazy morning breakfast!
author: Teresa W.

description: Pleasant servers, quiet on a lazy Tuesday morning, the coffee is fresh and the prices are reasonable.  And the food is damn tasty!
author: Roderick D.

description: This place is AWESOME. Delicious and cheap with really friendly staff. I got two pancakes, two eggs, 4 bacons, and home fries for like six or seven bucks. You will not believe the prices on the menu and everything is so good!
author: Cathy T.

description:
Golden Coffee Shop is the goods, great food, great prices and no fuss. 

We have been sampling different breakfast joints over the last week or so and this is the best of the ones we have sampled. 

The only thing that stops five stars is the coffee. But I am yet to have a decent coffee from any of the restaurants we have sampled.

This really is a great neighbourhood joint, not far from the Union Square tourist area. A credit to the owners and staff.
author: Garry P.

description:
golden coffee is the best! they know how to make breakfasts.  all bfasts come with toast and hash browns. the omelletes are amazing. i recommend joe's special. the bacon looks bad and way too dry so i've never bought it.

best part: CHEAP. dirt CHEAP.

ps - sit at the U counter. dont sit at a table. much more pleasant seating IMO. bathroom has a fun light switch to hit.
author: Victor B.

description: Great, cheap eats.  Very small place.  There are only two 4-tops and the wrap around bar.  The coffee is very good.  The omeletes, hash browns, sausage....its all good!  Don't go in expecting anything fancy, cause it's not, but again, it is good and cheap!  The staff is also very friendly.  Like others here have said, it's a great place to go with a hang over...roll out of bed and go.  This place has seen me looking my worst!  ;)  Heck keep your pjs on and go if you want.
author: Rise G.

description: What do you call a place who mostly has counter space as their main seating area? Heaven.  A square shape counter and a table, that's it. Small, easily missed, seriously non-decor, decor perfect place for easy, simple breakfast.  Had the usual pancakes, eggs, and bacon. Don't ask for organic, free range, or what not; this is a good old fashioned greasy spoon with the cook making a cornucopia of different meals on the grill. My only caveat is that you eggs may taste slightly of fish sauce. It could happen to you, but then again breakfast for two under $20 all in, rarely happens in this town. So, what's a little fish sauce in your eggs, when everyone eats at the counter?
author: Virginia A.

description: great little breakfast place, basic menu and good coffee. Coffee shop has only 2 small tables and seating at the U shaped counter. you will be able to see your breakfast being prepared by the cook . By the way the hash browns are fresh hand grated potatos . Had breakfast there every morning of my stay in SF , service was great and for about 5.00$ you had a great breakfast.
author: Maria s.

description: Just grabbed breakfast there, it's been at least a decade since I first started going.  It's a cheap and basic diner, nothing fancy about it.  As others have commented, a range of ages (today seemed to be grumpy old man nose-in-the-newspaper morning when I dropped in) and demographics all eat here in harmony (awwwww...).  I haven't eaten here on a weekend in years as it tends (tended?) to get busier than it's worth I think for the level of the food.  But it's cheap and good.
author: - Joshua -.

description: I want to call this place a well kept secret but thats tough when I now have to wait 5 to 10 for a seat. But wants you're IN that hangover will melt away and this warm chinese family will take care of you... whether you want soup and sandwhich, chinese or of xourse coffee, OJ, and breakfast done right, DONE CHEAP.   this is one of the best cheap eats in the hood and if I am foggy in the morning in the least, I zombie walk it over to Golden. A perfect place not overdone in the least, but with an almost exhibition kitchen...... Breakfast, with coffee and OJ for two including tip will e no more than  15$$$   and if your on a super budjet... ur looking at $5 out the door,  rib stickin good
author: Ian C.

description: You know...I've eaten here a few times and the food is just okay.  Not great, not good, just okay.  I've had the corned beef hash, the pork fried rice and the fish and chips.  Don't get the fish and chips, they were not cooked all the way and too salty.  The pork fried rice is good but too much onion is used.  The corned beef hash was probably my favorite.  I guess the moral of the story is to stick with breakfast.  At least the prices are cheap and it's a good hangover cure.  Things are just a bit oversalted in my opinion.  It's my roomie's favorite breakfast joint but that's not much of an endorsement as he's kind of a creature of habit and not terribly inspired (I LOVE you Jason!  Please don't put my toothbrush in the toilet).
author: Jill D.

description: by far one of the cheapest eats in the city ..and the food is great (and greasy) ive never spent more then about 6$ to get a full meal here
author: Micah W.

description: This is a dive restaurant.  But I like it.  It fulfils my need for a counter only diner (though they have tables).  It reminds me of a place my grandpa would take me.  We'd walk thru the vineyards, past the highschool, past the livestock auction and meet up with his brothers.  They would complain about the Reagan administration.  I would eat sorta burned hashbrowns and drink bad coffee.  They're all dead now and that coffeeshop and all the rest are buried under ugly cheek to jowl mediterranean style housing developments, and maybe a Home Depot too.   This divey place reminds me of them and all that and how almond trees make March smell like honey.  So I eat here even though it's probably dirty.  Plus, where else are you gonna find a two egg breakfast for 2.50?
author: Robyn C.

description:
cheap? hell yes!
tasty? yup!
best place to get breakfast after a long night? golden coffee.

two eggs four bacons toast hash browns and endless cups of coffee $6
author: Chelsea H.

description: A true greasy spoon.  Cheap and tasty food ranging from eggs to club sandwiches to burgers to stirfry, all filling, without hurting your wallet.  Coffee is mediocre and the place is nothing to look at, but who cares when you're getting your breakfast on for under or about $10 pp?  We've moved away from the 'loin, but we miss this place a whole lot.
author: Eclipse T.

description: I love the jack avacado and salsa omlette. With hashbrowns and toast, it barely gets over $5! It's a cheap, no frills breakfast with friendly service and is a fantastic way to nurture yourself after a night spent imbibing too much alcohol.
author: Lindsey G.

description: three dollars and fifty cents for breakfast.  ($3.50!!).  and really, eggs, toast and potatoes.  isn't that how much it should be?
author: Christy C.

description: This place is awesome. Delicious greasy breakfast, just what I crave for a late breakfast on the weekend. Quaint atmosphere, excellent prices. My girlfriend was quite happy with their fried rice (they have some chinese menu items available later in the day).
author: Nathan M.

description: I eat here every weekend and have the chicken fried rice for breakfast. It's the best. They cook up the chicken and fry the rice with the onions & egg right in the super-heated wok, and serve hot on my plate. The coffee is so-so.
author: Jason M.

description: This place has been a hidden secret for years.  I love that I can eat here for cheap.  Good old pancakes and eggs with coffee.  They are highly courteous and efficient, and the food is always hot, mostly because you're watching him cook it right in front of you.  It's definitely greasy and not for those who need whitewash and fancy lounge music.  Share a newspaper with the guy next to you.
author: Stephanie E.

description:
*edit*
the next time i ordered pancakes here, they were gooey and raw in the middle. i've since become a convert to han's across the street.

dirt cheap and really great for the price. strawberry pancakes were big and fluffy, perfectly cooked, not too sweet, not too greasy. boyfriend had a big plate of fat slices of french toast and four fat blackened sausage links (i tasted, greasy goodness). add some meh coffee and ok orange juice, total bill was around $14. service was super fast. i really liked watching the old guy's efficient movements cooking our food. the u-shaped counter is just the right amount of awkward to make it memorable. the 1-minute walk to my apartment plus a hangover made this place seem like a miracle.
author: Dana D.

description: no frills.  if you're in the tenderloin and in need of cheap, straight up american breakfast/chinese food, this is your place.
author: Helen T.

description: This place is amazing. The only breakfast place in all of SF that you can get tasty food and great coffee for less than $8 per person. It's unheard of! The guys that work there are awesome. I don't even have to order, they already know what I want. Plus they open at 7 am so if you've managed to stay up all night you can eat before you pass out. They aren't open for dinner which only makes you appreciate it more. It can get a bit crowded between 9 - 11 especially on the weekends. But its soooo worth it!
author: Victoria V.

description: cheapest meal Ive ever eaten in the city without lacking taste!  At first i was hesitant to stop by because of the appearance.  But dont judge this book by its cover.  Small place, which helps keep down the prices.  Fast, easy, cash only.  Go get breakfast here, vs across the st, cleaner I think and more enjoyable.  The best deal for your money on sutter st hands down.
author: Meg M.

description: I love coming here for french toasts! It's really close by my place so it's a great stop for breakfast on my day off! There's been times I see people in here that don't know that it's-Cash only! But there's a store across the street that has an ATM so no worries. Very affordable!
author: Diane M.

description: This place is really, really, really awesome for a breakfast cafe. The decor reminds me of a new york style cafe, but not in a scummy way. There are usually papers to read that people leave for others. This place is family owned, and the owner is very friendly and kind, and seems like a pretty happy old man. The food is delicious! Really delicious. Compared to Han's across the street, the portions are smaller, but still good sized. You can get anything from a small bowl of oatmeal up to an omelette or breakfast plate. The jack, avacado, and salsa omelette is probably the best omellette I have ever tried in my life. The coffee is bottomless for 1.35. The people in this place are always pretty cool, an unusual mix of art students, businessmen, and friends gathering in the city together. I really have nothing bad to say about this place, other than it's too delicious and nearby for me to resist. Note: Han's across the street is also very good. I usually alternate between the two businesses.
author: Alexander W.

description: Great local place to grab some cheap greasy food, and i mean cheap.  Not sure where Andrew K. is form but if he can find something as good and cheap nearby he should let me know.  It's definatly a hole in the wall and it ain't much to look at but I don't go their for the view.  The place to go when your hungover.
author: Jonathan F.

description: This is my local breakfast spot and I tend to go here only on the weekend as I rarely have time for breakfast on Monday through Friday, all this being said. Golden Coffee is quite the conundrum. While I love the food (bacon, two eggs over medium, french fries and white toast) and the price is certainly right, on three different occasions they have forgotten to serve me my toast with my breakfast, whats more is when they do bring it, approximately 10 to 15 minutes late, its not with an apology, not that I expect one but you know...It kind of would go a long way in assuring me they realize there is a problem and are trying to correct. Hell don't correct it, just sort of acknowledge it... Anyways I am still going to keep coming and I am still going to aggressively chase down my toast.
author: Salvatore R.

description: We have been going to the Golden Coffee for ten years, when one of our sons found it on a family vacation to SF. What a find!  Service is quick and polite.  The food is great breakfast fare, and it's unbelievably cheap for an SF restaurant in a good area.  Still $5 a plate for most items.  And the coffee was, well Golden!  Coffee in a lot of places like this is usually awful.  Not here, it's great.  The place is a little grimy, but you come for the food and quick service, not ambiance.  Compared to touristy places like Sears where the price is twice as much, this place is a steal.
author: John S.

description:
This is one of my favorite places for breakfast and lunch.
coffee is always fresh, food is good, and the price is very reasonable.
Staff are warm and friendly. I really recommend this place to eat out in San Francisco!
author: m y.

description: Come on, folks!  Cheap, reasonably good, idiosyncratic staff, interesting crowd to look at.  What more do you want?
author: Steve P.

description: sometimes you just gotta get your fill of grease. golden coffee is a great spot to fill up on it. good ol' grease spoons like that are hard to find nowadays....
author: bmwcafe c.

description: went here for my first breakfast after moving into town...this place is hilarious. when you walk in you wonder what you just got yourself into. it is very small and seating is pretty much only a U-shaped counter. there is definately a mix of people ranging from purple haired chicks, hung over 20-somethings, to the local vagrants who amassed $6 in change (enough for a feast). the skepticism quickly dissapears when your food is placed in front of you within 3 minutes of ordering. the food is awsome; big portions, really cheap, delicious on a hung over morning.
author: brian m.

description: this place is so great!  it's one of the most vintage/classic little diners i've ever been in.  it's the perfect little stop for the locals.  the food is so cheap, portions are large, it's delicious, the people who work there are wonderful and sweet and the setting is really lovely to be in.  postive energy all around, including everyone else who goes to this little mecca.
author: Steven K.

description: food is mediocre, kinda pricey for what you get. the place is old like the cook. service is good, not great. i love the family-run feel of this place though. the best part of GoCo is how convenient it is to go to, and the diversity of the menu.
author: Jeorge J.

description: I've been visiting the GC for approximately 8 years, when I first started going there it was the hidden treasure of cheap breakfasts (still is) that are guaranteed to cure the worst of hang overs and there was always a seat at the counter.  It has now become the place to go, and you almost always have to wait outside to get a seat during the weekend.  All I got to say is Jan is the man, the coffee is great, and you can never go wrong w/ the steak and eggs.  And if you're in the mood for lunch, they quite possibly have the best bacon cheese burger in the city.  The counter can get cozy rubbing elbows with all the locals, but hey, that's what makes it so fun!
author: Olyn L.

description: GOCO!!! This place is my favorite. I love prying myself out of bed to go meet up with friends at this wonderful diner. Always order the coffee that tastes so-so but manages to hit the spot, with hash browns, bacon...and if you're feeling friskey a side of chicken chow mein! Super tastey!!! I highly reccomend GO CO. If you're on a budget its your friend and the food is yummy.
author: Ashleigh V.

description: this place is great! delicious breakfast fare, friendly service, and it seems, that no matter how crowded the place is when i go (and it's usually very busy) my order is served promptly and still piping hot. and you cannot beat the prices. under five dollars for a waffle and two eggs?! yes, i'm definitely a fan.
author: Erica H.

description: cheap eats, and cooked good 0old mfashione dgreasy spoon
author: Leigh McInnis Lee G.

description: i love this place but it only gets three stars because i love the place across the street a little bit more. this is the best place for your typical super cheap morning after breakfast and it is so close to my house. the food is good i love the strawberry pancakes on holidays and the denver omelette regularly. the hashbrowns are perfectly golden the eggs fluffy and cheese. the coffee is strong and the service is wonderful. i give it three stars because of the seating. i am the type of person who likes to sit at a table and get coffee refills and read a good book for a while... so i go across the street
author: Rhonda Y.

description: good spot. fools who work here are in a zone. they just meditate and go into another world. if you watch them they dont think about anything. they are focused. so focused. cheap food and it tastes good. saw some fool hook them up with like a 20 dollar tip and the dude working there looked up at him like "what?" and the dood who gave it to him just looked back at him like "take it youre a pimp and you are meditating and you are at peace with the world". they nodded at each other and parted ways. it was a deep scene that i will never forget.
author: Wats C.

description: A zen temple of breakfast!  Golden Coffee never ceases to amaze me -- in my experience, every seat is always taken, but there's never a wait. Somehow, two people are just getting up to leave from the horseshoe shaped counter just as I arrive.  The staff moves about in quiet and determined focus -- never rushing, never dawdling -- carefully using tongs to place exactly two ice cubes (never more, never less) into your water glass as you are seated.  Conversation among both the staff and patrons is kept to a minimum and at a measured volume -- not reverentially hushed, but certainly not boisterous.  This is about breakfast, plain and simple, when you want a well fortified but gentle start to your day.  The pancakes are among the best I've ever had, and the egg dishes are straight forward and prepared exactly as you would expect by a classic diner.  A couple of Chinese-inspired rice plate dishes are available as an extra bonus at breakfast.  A golden choice for breakfast!
author: Matthew B.
